I think they think I have a real high end DSLR.*****Update**April 2014. I did update to a DSLR--After researching, comparing and fretting, I went with a Nikon D5300 and 18-55 mm lens. Awesome!Won't be giving up my L120 anytime soon, though. It'e still a fantastic camera.

Reviews.Title: great cam, for great pics
Reviews.Author: chester
Reviews.Content: this cam is amazing, just took it to vegas, great pics from the 13th floor at mandalay bay casino, the more u play with the cam the better ur pics will come out.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera & Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Roger W Pace
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera and I was able to take some great pictures after loading the batteries with out reading the manual. Very easy to use.The only problem I encountered was I could not get the flash to work manually after reading the manual. After 15 minutes of frustration, I called Cutomer Service. 30 seconds later I was talking to a live person and 1 minute after that the Camera was doing what I needed. The Camera deserves 5 stars just for the Customer support.By the way the red is worth every extra penny, G0RGEOUS.Layout and feel of the controls is superb.The Display is Large and easy to read.Zoom works smoothly.I haven't ran into any problems yet, if I do I will let you know.

Reviews.Title: Photos easily blurred in low light
Reviews.Author: C. Rowan "MyBikeScreams4Me"
Reviews.Content: There are so many positives to this camera, and if you don't need to take pics of kids all the time this camera is a keeper. Here are the positives:+Nice, well built body, feels fantastic in hands, very natural and not too large+Beautiful close ups, although can be a bit hard to find a focus+Easy, simple to use interface+Takes 4aa batteries, which was a big plus to me as they can be purchased anywhere, anytime.+The flash will never accidentally go off as button must be pushed+colors are generally nice and vibrant+Takes nice low light photos, but only with flash on.Negatives:-Photos easily blurred, and there is no flash available for pet mode or sport mode.-Flash does not go off when you put it up, you have to set it to on with button, inconvenient.-Red eye flash gives terrible color to photosOverall the thing that killed it with this camera was the blurry images. It's not reliable and very finicky. The pet setting is the best way to shoot moving subjects, although not perfect, it does take a pretty good sport photo with vr stabilization on. In pet mode you are able to take one picture at a time and the pictures come out quite well in sunlight. (play around with settings a bit to get a decent IQ) Continuous shots are available too, but not as smooth operating as other cameras i've used. The problem I have is indoor movement pictures. Without flash options on pet setting or continuous sport mode, my pictures are very substandard. I want to capture my kids blowing out their candles, roughhousing with each other, unwrapping presents, etc. If I were able to use flash mode it would be a much better camera for moving subjects. Don't get me wrong, I've gotten excellent pictures of my kids sitting still, and good ones of them moving outside, but anything inside with any movement is very hard to capture. Even outside pics are going to be blurry IF you aren't using the correct settings. For landscape photos and close ups this camera is very good. With a heavy heart I have returned this camera and instead am trying the nikon p500, hoping for more kid friendly results.Finally: I posted 2 of what I believe to be AMAZING pictures. Please take a look, this camera may be exactly what YOU are looking for.

Reviews.Title: Owning a Nikon
Reviews.Author: Tere Herrera
Reviews.Content: I was tired of bad quality cell phone photos...and I got this camera and man It was love at first sight!! or should I say photo!It  wont take you 15 minutes to figure the functions out. Macro is my favorite by far, best colors and overall resolution although the remaining features are great too..I don`t know I got a thing for Macro...The zoom in is awesome but it sometimes gets out of focus if you push it to much, however this can be fixed by zooming out and giving the lenses 2 seconds to readjust and work just fine!I have taken my camera everywhere, literally, and I have not been disappointed, I will truly recommend this camera to everyone!! It takes gorgeous pictures nothing to envy to a dslr camera. this camera does everything automatically and it does it perfectly.The biggest flaw on this camera are the regular AA batteries it use... having to carry 4 spare batteries isn`t fun and  even worst if you have to change them and miss a perfect photo :(Even with that I love this camera it was a great purchase.PS:May sure to buy Rechargeable Batteries Sanyo Eneloop AA NiMH Pre-Charged Rechargeable Batteries - 4 Pack and An SD card Transcend 8 GB Class SDHC 10 Flash Memory Card TS8GSDHC10E to fully enjoy your purchase

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L120
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! It was exactly what I needed. This camera is for people who aren't super serious about photography, but take enough pictures where you would want them to be of good quality. I love how clear the close ups are and how well the zoom works. I would definitely recommend buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot, BUT
Reviews.Author: G. Scholl
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter as a step up from her small Nikon P&S....assumed; it had a viewfinder, bit it does NOT so all shots must be made via the live view screen on back. Image quality is superb, and for the money it's a good buy.My mistake in researching this camera, also not as many manual options as i would have liked. Takes standard AA's though- always a plus, especially when traveling. Recommended, just be aware of what you're buying.

Reviews.Title: Looks great..
Reviews.Author: Ram I Mahato,
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews, I was torn between purchasing a Sony Nex 5 or a Nikon L120. I purchased the Nikon, but now i wonder..I was an amateur when I bought this, and honestly, I was amazed by how it looked. It looked sleek and and I thought it would take sharp photos-which it most certainly does, but it's missing that magical touch. I was aiming for background defocus because photos that have blurry background seemed amazing to me. When i take close-ups, the background is indeed out of focus, but when i take general photos, I can't get it to focus on the subject and leave the rest out of focus. I now realize i need something like a SLR, which is way out of budget for a 14 year old; yet, I am pleased with this camera compared to my old camera!If you are looking for a great point-and-shoot camera with brilliant zoom, than this is the camera for you!

Reviews.Title: I Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera is fabulous. It takes wonderful pictures, day night, snow, fireworks. I haven't found anything I can't get a good pic of. It is very easy to use, very user friendly. It has smile recognition, shaking doesn't affect it. It even takes good pictures of moving objects(sports, cars, boats etc). I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: NEW PURCHASE CAMERA--BEST CHOICE
Reviews.Author: colvin
Reviews.Content: GREAT ALL AROUND CAMERA BUT SHOP AROUND ALSO.  BEST BUY HAS THIS UNIT FOR $248.99.  CAN ANYONE BEAT THAT???NOW I HAVE JUST COME BACK FROM A 9 DAY CRUISE AND PICTURES GALORE.  ONLY PROBLEM WAS AT NIGHT AT A DISTANCE.  HAD TO TAKE MORE THAN ONCE ESPECIALLY WHEN I WAS ON A MOVING SHIP.  OTHER THAN THAT I CAN STRONGLY RECOMEND THIS CAMERA TO ANYONE.  WITH JUST A FEW HOUR USAGE YOU WILL BE TAKING GREAT PICTURES.  A PLUS IS THE DISTANCE SHOTS--THEY ARE GREAT, SHARP AND VIVID.  TRY IT YOU WILL LIKE IT!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: dtodj
Reviews.Content: Had purchased a Olympus SP 800UZ tried it out and was not very happy with the results grainy pictures with the telephoto, was in a store and was playing with the Nikon l120 and was impressed by the clarity of the viewing screen and the telephoto across the store. Went home and thought about it opened amazon and read the reviews, thought some more and bought the Nikon and when it arrived I set it up and took a few shots and was totally pleased with the results. The fedex driver was on her way back up the street and I flagged her down and asked if she had a digital camera and she said she did but not a good one. I said today is you lucky day and handed her the Olympus and said enjoy.Like very much that it uses AA batteries never have to lug around all the chargers and cords.zoom focus and clarity and color are top notch this camera does what it is rated as top of the line.con: when loading arcsoft panorama maker error message appears no vedframework dll go to site below and download and save file and place in file for arcsoft in program files and this will solve the problem.Please see this fix from Arcsoft for the "Panorama Maker5 for Nikon" :[...]

Reviews.Title: Terrific Value
Reviews.Author: Vman
Reviews.Content: Folks, this is an excellent camera for the price.  Just the right balance between style and substance - perfect for a technology simpleton like myself.  The images even at low resolutions are terrific.  Controls are intuitive and the greatest surprise was of course the video - excellent imagery along with a really good microphone.  Additional features that I really liked were of course the fact that this baby takes regular AA batteries and the preset features work like a charm - just point, zoom a little here and there and shoot.  If you are looking for an camera under $300 that will give you terrific images and video without having to learn a new language - this is it.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Review
Reviews.Author: S. Wall "S Wall"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on the reviews. I previously had a Nikon D40x that died and it was going to cost $250 to fix it, so I decided to look into a point and shoot camera instead. I've taken night shots, fireworks shots, close-ups, action shots, and more. I love it. The action setting is amazing!! I can't believe how clear these pictures come out. I was actually really impressed with the video quality as well. I went to a Toby Keith concert and shot some video and it came out fantastic, which I wasn't expecting given the reviews I had read of the video quality. The fireworks mode is also fantastic. The zoom is great...I was surprised how close you can get and how clear the pictures are (you do have to hold it very steady though).The SD card is in the battery compartment, which is the only negative I have to say about this camera. It would be nice if it was located in a more convenient place.

Reviews.Title: All you could want
Reviews.Author: dgd_reviews
Reviews.Content: I got this camera with intentions of having both great quality pictures and high definition video, WITHOUT spending an arm and a leg. I have been thoroughly impressed with this camera! It has proven to taken astounding pictures and shoot the nicest looking video I have seen through any "point-and-shoot" camera.In fact I happened to post a video on YouTube to demonstrate its HD capabilities. Feel free to see the video![...]Other than that, I couldn't have asked for anything better. I'm out traveling the world as I type this, and can say I'm proud to have such an awesome camera in my bag to help bring the memories forward.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jakepaul1"
Reviews.Content: This camera was great right from the start. It works nicely, good size, and it has great image quality!!! Its easy to use, easy to figure out, and it has great battery power. There are different options when it comes to the image (you can set it to snow, dusk daylight, black and white sports, etc.) I could not have chosen a better camera and i highly reccomend it. GET THIS CAMERA....... you will not be disapointed!!!

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Weil
Reviews.Content: The camera is very easy to use and the images are superb.  I use the camera to take pictures at an elementary school, and so far it has held up great.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L120 Great versatile camera For all purposes
Reviews.Author: Poorna Savithra Hettiarachchi
Reviews.Content: The images are excellent in any lighting condition, zoom is great with stabilizationit fits in the hand doesn't feel heavy or bulky in any way

Reviews.Title: GREAT POINT AND SHOOT, CAMERA CAN DO MUCH MORE IF YOU WISH!!!!
Reviews.Author: hollywood2009
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to spend the money on an SLR, since I largely don't have the patience for instruction manuals and technical maneuvering. This camera is the perfect solution for photographers who know what a good shot looks like, but need that extra, automatic "umph" that a good point and shoot provides.

Reviews.Title: Great for the cost!
Reviews.Author: John Jesensky
Reviews.Content: My wife has wanted a decent camera for a long time.  She's not a professional photographer, but she was sick and tired of the shoddy pictures her low-end digital cameras always gave her.She was nervous about getting a pro camera that she wouldn't know how to handle.  Can't take great pictures if you can't figure the darn thing out.  I did a quick google search and found this camera.  It is the PERFECT mix of professional, and amateur.  It gives you creative control over your images without needing a degree in photography.She is so pleased with her images now, and carries it with her everywhere.

Reviews.Title: best camera I've owned
Reviews.Author: Tracie Bobb "Tracie Bobb"
Reviews.Content: best camera I've owned, photos are super and the video is so nice, I covered a local house fire and you can see all the wayback in the upper bed room windows super clear in the video, channel 6 news was there and I shot video of everybody it was super.Tracie Bobb, Philadelphia, Pa.

Reviews.Title: Used and abused with great results.
Reviews.Author: Boxer fan
Reviews.Content: This is my everyday camera. I take it Kayaking, hiking, and all my everyday adventures. It takes amazing pictures. I love the anti vibration which is essential in telephoto shots. It takes low light pictures that turn out great. The sport mode is just the ticket for taking pictures of birds in flight, I took one of a dolphin leaping out of the water I couldn't have captured otherwise. I want to purchase a DSLR however I plan on continuing using this one in the field as I'm not afraid to get it wet or dirty. Since Nikon has it upgraded several times the price has dropped dramatically. So it is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: Should have listened to the bad reviews
Reviews.Author: egillan
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying we didn't research nearly long enough, & don't have a vast knowledge of cameras. We've both always had Canon's and managed to take great pictures with those. The one pro of this camera is it's ability to take an amazing still close up. Other than than I can't think of anything I like. The focus takes forever, it doesn't do well in low light situations & if you are trying to capture moving children...FORGET IT. It is a massive blur...even a slight movement from an object results in a ruined picture. We should have sent this back for a refund while we could, but we didn't, we kept thinking we would learn more how to operate it and we could fix the problem. Not so. If you want this for family use, don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Captures precious moments
Reviews.Author: britbrat
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing for the price. I've had issues with the camera focusing correctly sometimes. It usually has to due with the auto focus. If you change the lighting it normally fixes it. But beyond that, this camera takes amazing pictures. It is easy to use, I use the auto function mostly, but has plenty of options if wanted.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for the price
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Carvallo "Guillermo Carvallo"
Reviews.Content: At the begining i just try to buy for the brand, and when i got it, o my god it's amazing and you can do a lot of things with it.If you are not a pro you will feel like one with this camera, to be honest it's the best camera i have had in all these years.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L120
Reviews.Author: photography
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter a few weeks ago.  So far she loves it.  Consumer Reports rated it very high, that is why I purchased it.  It is a great camera for the price! :)

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: DCMama
Reviews.Content: I love this product!  The best 230 bucks I've spent! It's great to have a camera ready to take photos anytime!  The quality is great and is so easy to use!  Even my father who is electronically inept is able to work it!

Reviews.Title: Great little Nikon!
Reviews.Author: Ziggy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera at a warehouse club for a considerable discount.  I purchased it not knowing it took AA batteries; if I did I probably would have passed on it, which would have been a big mistake.  It takes excellent pics and very good vids due to the excellent Nikkor lens. Yes, it is mostly plastic, but that does not effect the performance at all.  Being less than a pound, even with the batteries, I have no problem carrying it around for all-day shooting. All the controls are pretty much standard to most point-to-shot cameras nowadays.  Contrary to a few comments made, I like the fact the flash has to be activated.  There is nothing more annoying then to have to fiddle with a menu to turn the flash off, or for auto flash, etc.  The only con I have is that the zoom is in steps and is pretty slow, but I guess that is a cost saving item.  All-in-all, I am very pleased with the L120 and would recommend it to anyone who wants a more advanced point-and-shoot camera for a tad over $200.

Reviews.Title: Very blurry with indoor photos!
Reviews.Author: nerak
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I liked all the photo settings and options.  While the pictures I have taken outdoors turned out pretty good, most of the indoor photos are garbage.  If you plan on taking pictures of people, especially kids, indoors with this camera don't bother.  Almost every picture I have taken of my kids is blurry, if something moves even the tiniest bit it will be blurry.  I've tried all the different settings with and without the flash and they still turn out blurry about 85% of the time.  I really wish I would have returned this camera within the returnable time limit from where I purchased it, unfortunately I didn't and I'm stuck with this camera.  I'm hoping I can save money to buy a different camera, this was a waste of my money.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for those who are trying to learn from it
Reviews.Author: Alessandra "Alex"
Reviews.Content: The problem with cameras designed for amateurs is that they attract exactly that, amateurs such as myself, who might not be able to get good pictures because photography is not something for amateurs. That being sad, I must say that I am happier now with this camera than I was three months ago when I bought it. I have managed to get around the most irritating problems, namely poor focus when anything moves (including the wind), not selecting the right "mode" in "easy mode" (for instance last week at about noon, full sun in the sierras, the camera chose "night landscape" for a landscape picture and of course it resulted overexposed). I now can say that given my expertise and experience, I happily get 20 good pictures of 100 that I take. Now, the lack of manual controls is really annoying but it is not the camera's fault, it is my fault that I could not afford a camera with manual controls. A good choice if you are patient, willing to learn, willing to carry around, and use, a tripod, and concentrating on framing.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: KLRoberts
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome camera for a non-pro and for those that don't want to drop a small fortune for a professional SLR camera.  There is a bit of a learning curve for those who are used to just pointing and shooting pictures on a standard digital camera.  My advice is to play with each mode available to determine in what situations what mode will give you the best quality pictures.  Eventually it will become second nature to you.Also, with certain modes it does take some time for the focus to become clear.  I have found that backing out the zoom and slowly zooming in on your target will produce a better focus.  I will be purchasing a tripod as this will also help with picture quality for modes where you are zooming in (no matter how steady you think you are, even with the anti-shake on, you will find it takes a lot of skill to get a clear picture because you are moving the camera even when you don't think you are).Also, this is what I call a two-stage snapper.  When you press the button to take a photo, the first stage brings the picture into focus and the second actually takes the photo.  The LCD screen will let you know when the optimal time to fully press the button by turning the red box to a green box.I have take some very spectacular pictures with this camera already (especially the macro mode).  I am very happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Photos, Difficult Flash Control
Reviews.Author: Tyson Nielsen
Reviews.Content: I would give this camera 4.5 stars if it were an option.We ordered this camera because, with a baby on the way, we wanted a camera that would take great photos quickly and easily, and does well indoors and in low light WITHOUT the complications of a Digital SLR.  This turned out to be a really amazing answer to what we were looking for, with very few downsides.PROS:-Amazing and accurate color and clarity in the photos.-Absolutely no noticeable "grain" in low light photos.-Very, very low lag time between pressing the button and the camera capturing the image for a point and shoot.-Many presets for many situations (indoors, fireworks, macro, etc.)-Just great photos.CONS:-Slightly larger that we thought it would be, but this isn't a big problem.-Little to no customization of settings. (No changing of aperture or F stop, or anything really). You have to mess with all of the presets to find what works in each situation. (This isn't an issue for us, we really got this camera to pull out and capture moments anywhere and anytime, and the presets are amazing.)-The flash doesn't automatically flip up when low light is detected, you have to do it manually.-In "Easy Auto" mode, it is impossible to get the flash to remain "on", it is always auto and resulted in motion blurred photos. (This is remedied by using one of the presets, where you have more control over the flash"Overall, this is the best camera I have used in it's class and the price is amazing.  We love it and have had zero buyers remorse.

Reviews.Title: Easy and Amazing in-one...
Reviews.Author: Satorogi
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptic to try this gadget but boy was I glad I trusted the reviews! First, I was disappointed when I found out that the battery is AA but then again, that is probably a good thing since there are rechargeable AA batteries and hey- it is a plus sign in case you ran out of it no charger around right?!The controls took only 25 test shots until I figured out the settings... We went to a museum and I used the "museum scene" setting- it worked like a charm. The rest of the scene settings did too... and the picture is crisp, clear and very much alive. This camera I consider a high-end point and shoot with an SLR feel... I would recommend this to anyone who loves taking photos of active kids to pets and is always on the go...

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but don't last
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera so I could take pictures and not always use my cellphone camera.  I love it.  It has different scene to adjust the lighting so the pictures come out great.  The video is awesome as well.  I would recommend this camera to anyone who loves to take pictures and wants something better than just the point and shoot cameras but not as complicated as the full on professional camera.UPDATE: September 2013.The camera doesn't work as well anymore.  Ended up buying a different camera all together.  It developed a delay to take a picture.  I would have to hold down the button for 5 or more seconds for it to take.  Sometimes it wouldn't take the picture at all.  Doesn't last but seeing as it wasn't a super expensive camera I got what I paid for.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L120
Reviews.Author: Bud "Bud"
Reviews.Content: A very nice camera indeed. Totally simple, yet absolutely creative, and picture perfect. I recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for one they really aren't sure about.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera! Must Buy!
Reviews.Author: abel casarez
Reviews.Content: The Nikon L120 is a must buy. This camera is more for beginner photographers. The 14.1 Megapixels are amazing and the 21X zoom is great. I recommend this alot. My aunts, uncles, and brother even want to buy one because of me. Simply amazing. Click that buy button. ;)

Reviews.Title: Everything I hoped for and more!
Reviews.Author: webhawk50
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer and this is my first digital camera.  I would first like to simply confirm everything Mr. Rosenow has said about this camera.  For those of you, like myself, however, who are looking for a truly impressive point and shoot, I can confidently say, "look no further".  Within less than a half hour out of the box, I was taking outdoor pictures that were truly impressive for a camera at this price point.  I sent a few of these off to a friend of mine whose husband is a professional photographer and she reported back how impressed she was with their quality.  Then I took some panoramic pictures of my back field and stitched them together with the incredibly easy-to-use software that is included without even reading the manual first, and I've never even done this before!  The results blew me away.  Once I actually read the manual, I got even better results.If I have a single complaint, it would be with the quality of my indoor shots. Some of my photos tended to be quite grainy. But please bear in mind that I have a LOT to learn about photography yet, so you must take this "complaint" with a very large grain of salt.  I think once I work with this camera a bit more and learn more about indoor lighting techniques, I have a feeling this will become a non-issue.  I still rated image quality with a 5 based on the results of all of my outdoor shots.  Most of those photos were of my animals who are sometimes in constant motion and, using the Pet mode (called a "scene" on the menu), they turned out terrific.  Please note:  I used a tripod in most cases.Again, I don't have a lot to add to Mr. Rosenow's excellent review.  I simply wanted to reinforce his findings and add my two cents from the perspective of someone just getting started with digital photography.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: The feel of the camera is just great, I have taken several pictures and they are amazing, specially night pix without flash, you can see the grooves of the moon for example, I surely recommend i for somenone looking for a great camera at a decent price. I bought it for $249 special.

Reviews.Title: The L120 and I; A Love story
Reviews.Author: colormechaos
Reviews.Content: I've had the L120 for a while now, and this is our love story. When I first got the camera I was so excited. I immediately opened the box and started getting to know the camera. Like every love story, there are a few bumps in the road to happiness. The first thing I noticed is that the sport continuous feature is not my favorite. In fact, my CoolPix from a few years ago has a better sport feature. There's lots of noise in the picture, and the edges are fuzzy sometimes. After fiddling with it for a while, and reading the manual, the fuzzy edges were no longer a problem. But there is still a lot of noise in the picture. I live right near the attractions in Orlando so I headed to Universal and took some pictures in the Wizarding World. The second thing I noticed was that the lens cap falls off easily when in a carrying case. The third thing I noticed was that the battery life is not wonderful. After reading previous reviews I was prepared for that, and I had rechargable batteries ready. However there are some really great features to this camera. Inside lighting is not a problem. Inside the castle at the wizarding world is very dark. This camera had no problem with this, and I have some amazing pictures from the portrait gallery. No flash needed. Adjusting the ISO is very easy, but most of the time you don't need to do any adjusting. My favorite feature with this camera, however, has to be the macro mode. It has a great zoom, which is great for sporting events and such. Since yesterday was the 4th, I also got a chance to try out the fireworks mode, which turns out is nice. It has a longer exposure than my other cameras, which is fun when you have sparklers and you can do light writing. All in all, I really do love this camera. It's my new favorite and I enjoy using it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L120 - a COOL travel companion
Reviews.Author: Nebraska Girl
Reviews.Content: I purchased a red COOLPIX L120 about a week before embarking on a photo safari to South Africa.  What a great decision I made!  The camera is great looking, easy to learn and comfortable for one-handed up-in-the-air, on-the-go picture taking.  In the Plus category: lightweight despite the need for 4 batteries; I took almost 3,000 images before having to replace my lithium batteries; great quality movies with good audio and stable playback; ability to crop images; color choices -- love the red!  My fellow travelers marveled at the ease of use, number of features that are relatively easy to maneuver, the quality of photos ... and the red!  In the Negative category:  the fact that I can't play .MOV movies on Windows Media Player and Windows Movie Maker which I'm comfortable with was a disappointment when I got home and found I couldn't watch the movies of the water flowing over Victoria Falls or the elephants and rhinos crossing the road or the giraffes grazing or the zebra tails wagging or the hippos bobbing up and down or the lions eating :(  But maybe I just need to learn how to convert the format or learn new software.  And I miss an optical viewfinder in bright sunlight.  Other than that, 5 stars for this one.

Reviews.Author: may-gin
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I haven't had any major problems with it yet.The only thing I don't really like about it is that it uses AA batteries, I wish it would have a rechargeable battery because I use it so much.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: kim lockhart
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with my purchase of this camera. I have taken MANY pictures with this camera and the batteries (regular energizer batteries) have held up very well. I got the rechargeable ones but can't review them because I haven't ran down these yet. (maybe it's the battery options need changed in some cases) I really can't understand the ones who complained about that, but that's my experience. The zoom captured a photo of a photo of my boyfriend (group football pic) from an auditorium wall, from the other side of the room, and the picture quality on that was even great. I'm shocked! I'd definitely recommend this camera. It's VERY easy to use and I LOVE the fact that the zoom is on the left. I couldn't be happier. Everything is at your fingertips and it's easy easy easy to use. It got here very quickly and I'm enjoying it very much. I'm sure many others will too. I get professional looking pics & I'm looking forward to many more!

Reviews.Title: Love Love this Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Lopez "Mom of 4"
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera 3 days ago and I absolutely love it!  I'm still learning how to use it properly, but so far almost all of my pictures have come out perfect.  I love the macro settings on this camera and the Smart Portrait feature is great as well.  The colors of everything being photographed are so vibrant, much more than the actual subject sometimes.  I would definitely recommend this camera.  So far I am still using the alkaline batteries that came with the camera and have taken well over 200 pictures and a few videos and the battery still shows full charge so it doesn't look to be too much of a battery hog.  But I still do plan on purchasing rechargeable batteries for it.I would definitely recommend this camera for those that are looking for an entry level DSLR without the hassle.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for the Price
Reviews.Author: Ashraf M Dehlawi
Reviews.Content: Bought it for a vacation, loved it. It is easy to use and the pictures are stunning. The HD video is amazing and so easy to start recording as you do not need to switch to a video mode to start recording. I also enjoyed the photo editing software that came with it, makes great panorama pictures.If your in the market with this kind of budget this is definitely your best option.

Reviews.Title: Great Fun!
Reviews.Author: Brad Beatty "I like to read things that provi...
Reviews.Content: This camera has made me into a picture-taking fanatic.  It is super easy to use, with a zillion nifty features I never knew existed.  Now I'm taking phenomenal pictures of birds, flowers, and just about every interesting thing I can find.  A very nice step between standard point-and-shoot cameras and the money-hungry SLR cameras.  The only improvements I'd like are manual focus and white balance.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bibek Bhattarai "biz_buzz"
Reviews.Content: This camera is just simply superb. You wont regret it. Crisp image.. nice night time image, excellent zoom, and a good price.Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Dave in Chi town
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research before buying so I'm very happy with my selection. It's easy to get great shots, fast. And the price is right. Only one thing I would add, a remote shutter switch. That would be very handy for extreme close up tripod shots (to avoid moving the camera while pressing the shutter), still love it though.

Reviews.Title: Nikkon Coolpix L120
Reviews.Author: Rafael FP
Reviews.Content: Recommended product.It's a great camera, much smaler that seems on the image and it have a nice grip.Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: camera review
Reviews.Author: Antonio Leal
Reviews.Content: great little camera with a lot of capabilities. enjoy it very much and has a venerable name in Nikon. I love it!

Reviews.Title: It's good, but it could have been better.
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "RaVen."
Reviews.Content: I've used over 30 different cameras in the past 5 years, once upon a time, I used a Nikon F3 and an F4 photo cameras, so I know camera's pretty well.  I would have to say this camera is an entry level camera for it's high powered zoom.  It's about $40 over priced.  It has some basic features, that are handy, but really it has a serious lack of picture control for someone looking for P, S and Custom modes.  But if you are the average consumer this is an easy, semi affordable camera with a whoppin 21x zoom!!! 14 mp is good too.  I was not overly impressed with the panorama mode, not that many people use this feature, but basically when you do a panorama with many other camera's it helps you take the photo, then stitches things together for you.  This camera however, helps you take the photos but they remain unstitched, which may be a good thing for those who want to stitch it themselves.Overall I would say, this is a good camera, but not a great one.  Not the once in a lifetime find one was hoping for lol.  I would have rather seen a 219 price tag on these, but I guess they're compensating for a 21x lens.DON'T TAKE YOUR CAMERAS TO THE BEACH, ESPECIALLY ON A WINDY DAY!!! I tell people that all the time, but I am constantly seeing people taking their cameras to the beach, and coming back with a jammed lens, This camera, will have the same issue, if you do take it, block it from tiny particles, it doesn't take much, and for heavens sake, don't lay it down for a moment.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons...Mostly Cons, though.
Reviews.Author: K's Mommy
Reviews.Content: I reluctantly purchased this camera despite the reviews being all over the place. I must say that if you are patient and are not using the zoom very much that the camera is not that bad; however why would one purchase a camera that has its features unusable? The zoom at great lengths is quite difficult to produce a blurry-free picture. The focus time increases as the zoom is extended - an issue NOT seen with most point and shoot cameras at the same distance and NOT an issue for the more expensive bridge cameras (ones like this that are not quite a DSLR, but not a point-and-shoot either). I know that most people are quite upset when a camera does not meet the standards or expectations they had, but you must really read the reviews, play with it at the store, and then make a sound decision about purchasing. I did all these steps and still ended up returning the camera less than 24 hours later because I did not want to "settle".If you are wanting an entry-level bridge camera for taking still shots and are quite patient with the focus and reload time, this camera will work for you. If you are looking for quick action shots, long zoom use and such, I would suggest staying with the point-and-shoot or upgrading to a compact camera or DSLR.A few things that might sway you one way or the other: the flash is a manual pop-up (good and bad), it takes AA batteries (I suggest buying rechargeable ones from Amazon - they're inexpensive here), it has small internal memory (not found very often in cameras now-a-days), plenty of scene options, easy menus.I hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Sweet low ligth pictures ! But blurry pictures !
Reviews.Author: camara loco
Reviews.Content: I 've had it for a while now and this is my review :The good :Excellent pictures in almost no ligth conditions ! to the point that almost no use of flash is require! its just that great,Ive had other cameras by Canon and none did this good of a job without adjusting any settings!Movies look really clear  I also got the HDMI cable ,but even whitout it it looks realy good)in HD.The zoom is good,and easy to handle.The Bad:Not much to say,the focusing sometimes may not work but it has to do with the type of ligthing ,if you shoot in low ligth it may have a harder time focusing or if shooting a very brigth object such a ligth bulb ,it also "thinks" a bit before focusing .No Sd card included and no HDMI cable.Conclution:Worth every penny easy to use, easy to download, feels good in the hands.I say Get them while their last,I got the burgundy color and its really nice!UP DATE:Well I had to send my camera for repair with in a month ! I was recording a video and its started  acting weird, the focusing  did not work and every time I clicked the shooting button it turned off ! So at Nikon i was told nothing was wrong  but instead i was told that the cause of it was that my sd card was almost full. It could be but I'm not too sure.Since I have read about the same problem with other people.Any way I was taking pictures xmast  nigth and I could not make the flash work for me it did not let me use it ,it did work but not in the auto mode i guess the camera takes over and decides when its needed buyt the pictures were too dark. And lastly you really have to wait a couple of seconds and the subjects must not  move a hair or it will be blurry (in low ligth conditions only) I have no time for all this drama i will stick to my D3100 wich really is excellent. I will not recomend this camera any more .I have  down graded it from 5 stars to  two stars !

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: FL Guy "FL Guy"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I took a few pics with this camera and the issues are the same. I also bought at another warehouse that starts with the letter C, the Coolpix S8100, as that also has good reviews and is fairly zippy in the speed department (bootup, shot to shot and burst mode). The difference is night and day. I am going to post up a picture of a comparison shot I did, with the S8100 right out of the box. Let me put it this way, after two L120's (I REALLY wanted to love this camera), on this one shot of the S8100, I took 8 shots with the L120, and NONE of them came out as clear as the S8100. Only one came close, and after looking at it on the display, I redid the shot, same settings and it was more blurry than before. EIGHT SHOTS!!!!! I ahve a 16GB card, but EIGHT SHOTS for none to come out clear???? Unacceptable. I'm not a fool, I've taken digital photography courses, and know how to hold and shoot a camera. But the quality was unacceptable. I'm glad some of you have taken great pictures. Maybe Sam is getting junk at his club, but TWO???? C'mon. Look for the picture of the Toy Story cups. Its sad to see this camera go, but it must.______________I bought this camera after extensive reviews. Everyone generally seems to like it and only a few complain about the quality and the blurriness of the photos. I am now in that complaining group. We got this camera because our old Canon A540 died on us. I know the wife was the reason as she always complained about the slow shot to shot speed of that one. So while she wanted something faster, I wanted something that had a better zoom, and actually felt like a camera. I was hoping, before it died, to replace it next year, with the Lumix GF3 that was coming out next month. I figured next year's tax money would pay for the camera. However, we couldn't wait, nor did we want to spend $600+ on a camera. sooooo....I bought the camera from one of the big warehouse stores. I LOVE the camera in terms of how it feels, the options, etc. The continous mode was great. very speedy. I've held and tested various Fuji and Kodak models, and I wasn't impressed with the menus of the Fujis and the Kodak, i've always felt something was missing. I was told Asthon Kucher used this in a commercial so I joked I would take it back then. since this was the first dSLR-looking camera we had, I started to read the manual to try and figure it out first. I am the one that usually figures the settings out, and the wife usually does the auto.. So, I'd take a few pics of the kids on various settings to see which was better. Throughout it all, the camera was very hit or miss in terms of quality.Let me explain. On some shots, like of the kids from about 15 feet away zoomed in, I'd do the Easy Auto and it would be ok. slight blurry of them. I'd move to another mode, and really blurry. I'd go back to the easy and it would be blurry. I'd do several, just to make sure the kids didn't move (while telling them to not move) or I moved, but each time they'd get blurry, some more than others. Same thing with using flash. I don't like how I cannot dial the flash down, like the A540's, but the camera did take better shots without the flash in some instances, than the A540. However, again, sometime the camera would get blurry. I found that in many instances, if the kids were anywhere close, the Auto mode, with Flash fill worked best. But then again, sometimes it was good, others not, but usually it was.Outside was better. I took pics of the kids running around in the sprinklers and they generally came out ok.But it wasn't as good as our old pokey A540. For the price of the camera, the pics should have been better. Taking longer zoom pics generally were blurry, even with the vibration and antishake enabled. I tried changing the focusing modes, ISO, etc, and it didn't help. The wife wanted to get rid of it before and get a cheaper one, but I insisted to give it another try as the cheaper ones wouldn't be as fast. However, the quality kept being a disappointment.Since I REALLY want to like this camera, I took it back and got another one, which was fine for me, as the price went down, and as a result, the extended warranty did too. So for less then the camera in the 1st place, I got the camera and extended warranty.Initial shots showed the same issues, but we will see this weekend. I'll post up an update. However, I am now looking at the Nikon S8100 as it has a 10x zoom, and is very speedy. I may buy that one and do side by sides when I use them both to compare. I also like the Canon S4500 too. Who knows.

Reviews.Title: Nikon is the best!
Reviews.Author: donald archambault II
Reviews.Content: This camera has been through everything three deployments, camping, hiking, hunting, fishing trips and still works as good as the day I bought it!

Reviews.Title: decent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: shooter
Reviews.Content: we've had this camera for 2 years now, and if you know how to take pictures you can get some pretty good ones with this camera. The difficulties that we've had are with action shots or even shots where people or things might be moving slightly (like little kids). It does have action modes, but of course those turn out horrible as far as lighting is concerned. so if you expect to take a lot of action photos this is probably not the camera for you, but if your looking for a decent point and shoot with a little more advanced capabilities and lighting options then this will do. also the cap thing is a little annoying but you get used to that

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: Mystic Rhythms
Reviews.Content: Best dam Camera I ever owned. It takes professional pictures that are second to none. So glad I purchased this specific one!

Reviews.Title: Kodachrome
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Wilbanks
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best affordable point & shoot on earth. Made for smaller hands than mine but I got over it. Easy controls. feature rich. I like it. Optical zoom is dead on. A little slow on final focus but not enough to be annoying. For the money. Yes.

Reviews.Title: nice camera for the money
Reviews.Author: gordster
Reviews.Content: i bought this to see if my kid was really interested in photography or just a fad she was going through, now i wish i'd bought one with a removable lense as she is really into it.  she has become quite the artist in taking some beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: I love it!!!
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: Upon receipt of my anticipation of this model, I was excited to being using it immediately. It takes awesome pictures.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera specifically for a land/cruise Alaska vacation.  I was very disappointed in the quality of the pictures.  It works great if all you want is 'still' landscapes, but if you have any motion whatsoever or dim light the pictures invariably were blurred.  the zoom is adequate for the motor drive portion of the zoom but almost useless regarding the digital zoom.  In almost all of the digitally zoomed pictures the subject was almost unrecognizable.  Of all the point and shoot cameras I have owned, even those for considerably less money this one is the worst. The 'auto' modes are completely useless when it comes to action shots. It seems the only way to capture a picture with any motion, even if the subject just nod their head, is to use the 'sport' mode.  Of course this means you have to discard 6 or 7 pictures to keep one 'good' shot.  All in all a major disappointment for a NIKON branded camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and enables creativity
Reviews.Author: L Woodruff
Reviews.Content: This camera was a great buy.  I have known what model I wanted for over six months.  I found a refurbished one listed as "like new" condition.  Well the condition was absolutely true; not even a single scratch on the body, screen, or lens! The auto focus option really takes guessing out of what setting to use. But, it’s flexible enough I can manually focus if I am going for a particular visual affect.  My son and I had a great time playing with the sports shots.  It fires out about 20 action pictures so quickly, and quietly we didn't know it captured anything the first time, but the pictures were wonderful.  This Nikon camera gives us lots of options for shooting great pictures and playing with creativity. It was a great investment for my family.

Reviews.Title: The Best for Quality Nature Pics
Reviews.Author: Kendra
Reviews.Content: The first digital camera I ever used was a Sony with .3 megapixals and a floppy disk to store photos on.  When I bought my first digital camera, I chose an Olympus and then a Canon and now a Nikon.  Each of the three brands has their pros and cons.For the longest time, I was not a fan of Nikon.  I was the yearbook sponsor at our school and every picture I took inside had a yellow hue that I had to correct in photoshop later.For me, my Canons have always worked better inside.But outside shots, for the nature pics that I love to take, my current camera the Nikon Coolpix L120 delivers awe-inspiring photos.  The sky even on a bright sunny day, never looks washed out.  The blue of the sky, the blue of the water is so rich it almost doesn't look real.  The camera seems to predict mistakes I will make.  When I took a picture of an alligator behind several reeds, it didn't get confused and take a picture of the reeds but blur the alligator or vice versa.  Both were in focus.  The macro setting also works well and even without a tripod, I have taken pictures of the moon on full zoom, that were crystal clear.My only complaint is that the camera has no optical viewfinder which means that on those sunny days, I cannot see what I'm taking a picture of on the screen.  I just take 20 or so shots and hope for the best.  If I had to do it again, I would buy the version with the optical viewfinder.Still, a camera I've been very pleased with.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Nakila
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera! Only downside so far is that the screen scratches easily and my screen protector won't stay on that well, but I'll find a way to fix that. Otherwise it's a great buy! Really enjoying it!

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L120 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 21x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD (Red)
Reviews.Author: verna
Reviews.Content: great camera i love it I just use it at a High School graduation and the pictures are amazing tNikon COOLPIX L120 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 21x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD (Red) is easy to use and great pictures its alittle heavy but the pictures are worth it

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: computer guy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, it takes a little getting used to. you need to hold the camera absolutely still to get a perfect picture, if you move a little the picture will turn out a little blurry. otherwise it is a great picture and takes really good pictures especially with the 21 optical zoom. It gets really good close up pictures.

Reviews.Title: Never again...
Reviews.Author: Richard Presley Joyce Jr.
Reviews.Content: No view-finder. Mediocre lens (Though Nikon touts it as a Nikkor lens. They shouldn't be too proud of this one.) Smart focus not very 'smart' at all (A lot of my photos are taken along the Atlantic Ocean shore and smart focus cannot focus on the horizon of the ocean. Only the landscape mode will.) Most photos 'washed out.' And who really needs all these silly modes? I would have gladly given them all up for a decent lens and a view-finder. If I pop-up the flash, I expect a flash in any mode, but not with this camera. I paid full retail at $280.00; I easily paid that much for what should be at most a $100.00 camera. This was my first Nikon, and it is my last Nikon. Never again. It's back to Canon for me.

Reviews.Title: Bad Focus
Reviews.Author: Daniel Reyes
Reviews.Content: This camera generates pretty good pictures for a point-and-shoot when it can focus and correctly identify lighting condition, but that rarely happens. Under "full auto" and preset modes this camera does not know where to focus even when taking the multiple pictures from the same spot. I'm returning this camera because I can't count a good picture when I need it so I'm going back to DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for a real estate appraiser
Reviews.Author: Steven P. Gray "Real Estate Appraiser"
Reviews.Content: I am a real estate appraiser and really like this camera.  It uses 4 AA batteries, so I'm never caught in the field with a dead proprietary battery.  The zoom is very good and the wide angle is great for interior photos of homes.  It locks on focus fairly quickly, though not as quick as a dSLR; good enough for what I do.  The only issue I have is that it doesn't do well with sunlight glare.  I wish Nikon would make an optional "hood" for it.  I also have to set the exposure one click on the + side since picture tend to come out just a smidgen too dark.  Other than that I'd definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: ceri
Reviews.Content: Our 12 year old daughter loves photography and has been in a couple of photography classes.  She was using a Kodak Easy Share, which was great for a young beginner.  We wanted to upgrade and so we bought the Nikon COOLPIX L120 for her for Christmas.  It has been great!  The quality of her photos is much better and she enjoys all of the additional settings this one has to offer.  We definitely recommend this camera to anyone who wants great quality photographs without spending hundreds of dollars on lenses, etc.

Reviews.Title: Stylish and reliable mid level camera
Reviews.Author: L "Me"
Reviews.Content: I recently returned home after taking my relatively new Nikon L120 red on a 3 weeks long trip to India. Without knowing much about its full capabilities, I was able to experiment in the moment and still get some amazing pictures. Not all but most. I liked the sport mode for taking pictures while in a moving car and for far away images of the street from the rooftop of one of the hotels In which I stayed. I was able to see great details from pretty far away even beyond the camera's yellow bar indicating the focus was AF.One of my main gripes from my experience was the sunrise/sunset mode and taking pictures at dusk of the many colors and faces which and who graced our early morning and evening walks. The flash was a bit much and made images a little garish, something I was able to somewhat address with some editing software but I am not a big flash fan anyway and would rather not use it. The shutter ended up being open too long. Some pictures with the blurry looked arty while others were throwaways, er, deletes. And I agree with another reviewer who mentioned the annoying lens cap as well as losing precious time if I turned on the camera without first removing it.But my #1 gripe is that it used AA batteries and it is one hungry beast. I could not use rechargeables and I went through so many batteries it was embarrassing. I wish it had a NiCad battery which would not only reduce environmental waste but the charge would last longer. No one likes hauling a 36 pack around in one's day pack. Based on that my next camera purchase will definitely have an internal battery charge feature.I  think if I spent a little more time learning about the L120 and anticipating its peculiarities my next set of adventure photos will be that much better. Recommended with the suggestion of using it as much as possible before setting off on your once in a lifetime experience. :)))3.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: easy to use; great pics
Reviews.Author: chucknduck26
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, but I needed something that could zoom better than my little point and shoot. This camera takes good pictures, has great zoom and is easy to use. Exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: UP UP and AWAY
Reviews.Author: JoAnn "JoAnn"
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews on this camera but have been using the smaller cool pix cameras for a year now and wanted a little more macro.  We photograph tinny tinny beads and the original cool pix that we bought had already replaced our 6 meg Pentex and heavy macro lenses(state of the art when we bought it). Nikon was one of the first to offer macro in a point and click I wanted to see how they improved and boy did they.  I am pulling more detail in all my photos we also added the CowboyStudio Table Top Photography Studio Lighting Tent Kit. Between the 2 WOW.  Some of the reviews I read were about blurry pictures and people were really unhappy so keep in mind our review is for those close up still shots. The cool pix dose take a little time to learn because they have many extra setting you can use and ours is always set for close up macro shots. For the best photos with this camera play with the green settings button and try them all out to find the setting that work best for your application we have been able to shoot indoors with minimal light (usually happens when I'm carrying the camera back to the computer to download and well take a picture of my feet, the wall, or the dog snoring ya know the ops I bumped the button again shot). If I were talented and didn't shake so bad I would probably go back to a professional camera but for our needs the quality is what we need. Thank you Nikon cant wait to see what you do next year.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: J.S.
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  Got it on sale here.  This Nikon takes great pictures for the price.  Has an excellent zoom, a bonus feature on the camera is that it has a button to adust the zoom on the top and the side of the camera. Camera is nice and compact.  Havent tried all the shooting modes yet but I can say that the sports shooting is better than I had expected it would be, takes pictures fast and the quality remains good.  The video recording also works good.  Video and sound is real clear but the zoom ocould be a little better in video shooting mode. The flash works really well.

Reviews.Title: Loving it so far
Reviews.Author: Cilla
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a couple of days now, but so far, I'm very happy with it. The pictures and video are clear with beautiful color. Photos in dimly lit areas are no problem and the zoom is wonderful. Only drawback so far is that I sometimes forget to remove the silly lens cap and the cheap batteries that came with it are drained already. I'm sure some good rechargeable batteries will work great. This is a very nice camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: Camera freezes
Reviews.Author: William J. Doherty
Reviews.Content: The camera was a gift to my wife who really liked it. It was easy to use and took great pictures. But, after a few weeks it started to freeze up at various stages of operation and required me to open and close the battery compartment. I called Nikon support and they had me try a few things but no good. I have returned and ordered another. Sometimes you just get a bad one.

Reviews.Title: One nice looking camera.
Reviews.Author: Andy Huynh
Reviews.Content: I just got it today; and I must say, it looks even better than I thought.  I'm not an expert when it comes to cameras; plus, I have not play around with it long enough.  It looks great, very good picture quality, and I love the wide LCD screen. Definitely one of the accessaries that I'm very proud to own.

Reviews.Title: Great in Every Way But...
Reviews.Author: M. C. Gasper ""Forever a Reader""
Reviews.Content: Like many other owners, I did research and selected this camera based on feedback and Consumer Report info.  My previous camera is an Olympus, and I was reluctant to buy another camera because it was such a positive experience, but the camera started acting weird with the memory cards and they are no longer available.  The Nikon is great.  I am not going to repeat what everyone else has said about its features.  I have not used the video.  Not really a video person(except on my ipad2). So, overall, great camera. BUT, Nikon really missed the boat when they put the battery/memory card slot on the bottom together.  What's that about?  Every time I go to take out the memory card, I have to turn the camera upside down and leave it that way so the batteries do not fall out.  Locking the 'door' is a real pain.  No longer can I stand in place and remove my card and insert it in the slots.  Before, I could open the slot door, pop out the card, and when finished, pop the card in and close the door. Done. No messing with the batteries or holding the camera a certain way.  With the NIKON model, it's like handling glass. Awkward. I prefer to take the card out and view the pictures through the sD slot rather than connecting the camera to the computer with a cord.For me, that is the negative part of owning this camera.  Would I recommend it?  Yes, but I would definitely point out this feature. The pictures are great, the choices are many, and the results are pretty awesome for this type of camera.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: naturesson "Naturesson"
Reviews.Content: Have used for a month or two.  I like it.  Still figuring out all the bells and whistles but so far, so good.  Instructions are simple to follow.  Doesn't come with any memory card so buy this package also on Amazon...."16GB Essential Accessory Package For Nikon Coolpix L110 L120 L100 Includes 16GB Memory, Case, Tripod, 4 AA High Capacity NIMH Rechargeable Batteries +".  Very good bargain and functional.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: greatpix
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix L120 last month after much deliberation between buying a Nikon or Canon. As a magazine publisher, I wanted a camera that would give me SLR quality at a digital price for my casual photos. This was a great choice. I took a photo of a painting when the room was completely blacked out (dark) and with flash the photo came out clear as day. All my photographs are crisp and look lifelike when I zoom in on my photo viewer. The resolution is excellent!!! My one small issue is the image stabilization which is not in the lens but apart from that this camera is excellent. Worth every penny!!! Do not hestitate to buy it!!!

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: JudinSD "judy2river"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera with more zoom, easy to use & small enough to easily travel with, this camera meets all the criteria. I received this camera last week and from the pics I have taken it takes great pics of closeup photos of nature i.e. flowers, birds etc. I am a senior and I can say this camera was very easy to setup and easy to use. I would definitly recommend this to anyone. This is a great camera for its price!

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera...  Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Doctor A.
Reviews.Content: As an experienced DSLR photographer, I was looking for a small, easy to use camera for my wife and I for vacation travel. We've used our L120 for several weeks now and can offer only high praise for this outstanding camera.It is small and light enough to easily fit in a coat pocket, handles a wrist strap well, and feels comfortable and convenient in our hands. The battery life is fantastic, especially with 4 AA lithium batteries. The low light photos (without flash) are superb, even at ISO 100. The telephoto lens is exceptional at 25-525mm (35mm equivalent). We do use a Slik monopod to steady those long shots and get great results.Just read the brief Getting Started guide, select the AUTO setting for most situations, and then smile at your terrific photos. There is little the L120 doesn't do well. A truly superior camera at a very attractive price.

Reviews.Title: Cool Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: MB
Reviews.Content: I always like fuji cameras... but the last time I ordered fuji, it was not working like it supposed to.  So after reading and researching a good point and shoot camera... I came to purchasing this item.  As soon as I got it, I tested it with all the bells and whistles.  TO TELL YOU THE TRUTH... EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!!!  Especially when I try to use the video mode, you can zoom while recording and playing it back to see if you can hear the zooming (which fuji had disappointed me with) YOU CAN'T HEAR THE CAMERA ZOOMING.... AWESOME!  IT IS WORTH THE PRICE!! :)

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: tssandeep
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, with nice features and good looks. Good value for money. A Sony or Canon cam with similar features is far more expensive. Size of the camera is the only drawback I found.

Reviews.Title: Cool Nikon Pick
Reviews.Author: Terri L. Simpson
Reviews.Content: Ordered on Sunday afternoon and it was delivered on the following Saturday afternoon. Just in time for my upcoming camping trip and football game weekend. This camera does all it says it can do. I love it. Perfect for someone like me who's not a professional but still wants ample shooting options. A little slow to re-focus on the zoom. Thats the only con I can see. Takes great pictures and allows you to edit them right on the camera. Coolpix L120 is the bomb.com!!

Reviews.Title: excelent!! :) happy nikonist again
Reviews.Author: Monica M. "Monica"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for one of my assistants at work (i'm a marketing manager) cuz he does all the product photography here (we are a retail store) and the images were horrible before with a commercial small camera... I'm a photographer myself and own a D40 so I hate to see these kinds of pictures.So i went searching and as Nikonist of course I thought this was the best choice for price and purposes, and I'm very happy with it! :) Images are sharp, batteries last a lot..Only 2 suggestions:-Would have helped a lot if it had a li-on rechargeable battery (I went searching but the difference between this little sweet and others with similar features was exagerated in price range.. )-- i've seen bad small cameras with rechargeable battery (li-on) so i think nikon got caught on this one-Zoom is fine: you have 2 options to do it: zoom at top (around shutter button) and zoom at lenses with a small joystick.. this one is nice but it would have been better if you could just have a manual option... it was funny cuz when i tried it i found out i'm so used to the d40 that i went on trying to move the lenses lolOther than that this little sweet gives great pics , is sturdy as her dx sisters and at a great price! :)great for offices, mini studios and product photogaphy

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Dora De Carrasquel
Reviews.Content: It's great product at reasonable price and free shipping.I used it in my Nikon Coolpix model to record clips it is great, Nikon Coolpix is a must for digital camera when you're on trip/vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I'm into photography, and I decided to finally bite the bullet and buy a nice camera. Only an SLR was a little out of my reach, but then I found this camera. Its perfect for those photographers who want a high resolution, tons of shooting modes, and a great 21 times zoom. If an SLR camera is out of your reach, BUY THIS CAMERA! Also battery life is excellent, I use my camera constantly, and still haven't needed to replace batteries (camera still says batteries are full) since getting it two weeks ago. Only downside is it takes AA's. But I just bought rechargeable AA's with a cheap charger. Big screen on back too.

Reviews.Title: Easy camera to use for a novice
Reviews.Author: greeneyes63
Reviews.Content: I feel like a novice although I love taking pictures but don't like it to be complicated. I did want something more than a point and shoot. The last camera I had (Kodak) I did not like. I have had this camera about a month and I am very pleased. I took a trip to San Francisco recently and got some incredible shots of the architecture of buildings from the top deck of the tour bus. They were great shots. The zoom is the best I have ever had. I am learning to use the ISO features and that definitely makes a difference. It is easy to handle although bulkier than the type of camera you can slip in your pocket. I have only shot video a couple times and it was ok. The volume was quite low which I have read others complain about.Overall I am very pleased,Only downside there was no owners manual with the camera. It has a dvd with instructions but I like having a book I can look at if I'm out of town.

Reviews.Title: cool Nikon COOLPIX
Reviews.Author: A Garden nut
Reviews.Content: So far I have tried this camera in my garden and in my house.  I think the photos came out rather well.  I read the instructions to connect it to the computer and may have had to experiment a little before I actually found where the photos were stored in my files; however, this did not take a lot of time.  I feel comfortable with it and look forward to when I fully understand all it has to offer.  I was glad to have received it so quickly as I want to use it for some wedding photos in the near future.  I must say that the len's cap is frustrating as once it is taken off, it does not go back.

Reviews.Title: Is awesome
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, based on the reviews, and Thanks is the best camera ever, for a noob. My only complain is that I can't keep the shutter open.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!!!
Reviews.Author: Faye Hejduk "Faye"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this a few days before my kids birthday party and it arrived quickly and thankfully VERY easy to use! The image quality is great - and I was very happy with the camera! I have gone through 3 digital cameras in the last few years and for this or that reason they stop working so I decided to check out ratings and look for a GOOD camera for once and this one is GREAT quality for a wonderful price! I highly reccomend!

Reviews.Title: I Luv This Camera
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for myself and my daughter-in-law. We both needed new cameras and so we did some research and decided this was the perfect camera for us. We have taken some amazing photos, videos and some photos distances away from us that I never thought we could make work. I would buy this camera several time over, oh wait I did, I turned around and bought my other daughter-in-law one too. We are having a great time with these cameras and look forward to taking many more pics that will last a lifetime.Dee

Reviews.Title: Patino's opinion on Nikon
Reviews.Author: Patino
Reviews.Content: Recently purchase the Nikon Coolpix L120.  My main purpose was to get a camera that was easy to use.  I wanted a point & shoot camera that had the ability to zoom in/out and still produce quality pics.  Was able to use the product right out of the box.  The quick start guide was all I needed.  Have taken some photos with the telephoto and it is working as it advertised.  Have not used all the features yet but so far I am satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Josh G. Reese
Reviews.Content: I am by no means a photographer but this camera has allowed me to take some really great pictures.  The preset settings are generally really great and the panorama assist is PERFECT.  Would recommend this camera to anyone that wants to take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: T. JONES
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a little over a week ago. So far, I haven't had any problems with it at all. Navigation of menu is uncomplicated. Seems very sturdy and durable for a cheaper point-and-shoot. I really love the large screen.While shooting outdoors with my 2yr old, I was able to capture action shots beautifully. I am also impressed that I can zoom in fully on the moon and take pics that show full detail of craters. With my cameras of the past (Fuji FinePix S9000 and a 12mp Kodak EasyShare) all I could get of the moon was a streak of white light. If I can, I will post a pic just to show you the detail involved.I have recommended this camera to all my friends. Its perfect for my little family and the type of shots we like to take.

Reviews.Title: Too much green color in the Nikon L120 outdoor photos?
Reviews.Author: Snowbell
Reviews.Content: I just purchased a Nikon L120 from Amazon. I tested it in a nice day outdoor, taking photos of an open space view with hills, trees and a beautiful sky.The L120 camera is a nice camera, overall. However,all my outdoor photos come out with too much green in the photos. I am not sure if this is just the way Nikon L120 is, or is there some problems with the sensors of this particular camera.I went back to my old camera, Kodak Z650, to take duplicate photos of the same view, just for comparison purposes.Comparing the two sets of photos side by side, the blue sky in the Z650 photos definitely are more true to the real life sky color. The L120 photos have way too much green in the photo.I also notice that there is noticeable LESS red/brown color in the L120 photos, compared to the Z650 photos, which causes the L120 photos to appear too green.I am wondering if there is a way I can reduce the sensitivity of L120 on green and enhance its red/brown?Or should I send the camera back, assuming that there is some problem with the camera?

Reviews.Title: Worst camera ever
Reviews.Author: Marianna
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for about half year now and I just hate it. It's OK for taking pictures outside in the daylight, but you can't do anything indoors. Doesn't matter what settings I do the pictures are blurry and colors look unnatural. Going back to my compact camera.

Reviews.Title: Totally Frustrated : ( !!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Beiner
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift and I am soooooo returning it ASAP! Definitely read ALL the reviews (pros and cons) and you will note the biggest concern is BLURRY photos. I have tried everything and bottom line, if I have to play around and waste time trying to make a camera work, then it's NOT worth it! Save your money and move FAR away from the Nikon Coolpix L120!

Reviews.Title: A must buy for camera users
Reviews.Author: Old Gregg
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera that I have ever purchased for it's price and abilities. The images are sharp and clear. It's easy to use and the batteries last a long time. Give it a try and you will see for yourself how great a camera this is.

Reviews.Title: sent back
Reviews.Author: Karen Beason "jacksmom"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an easy to use camera that took great pictures. This camera doesnt take good pictures in low light. Pictures outside are fine (like any camera). In my opinion the shutter speed on auto is way too slow. Im now going to purchase the 3100 and hope I like it better.

Reviews.Title: Saleman At Best Buy Owes Me A Cruise
Reviews.Author: S. Seville "mamafruitcake"
Reviews.Content: HATED this camera.  Had a Canon picked out, but the salesman at Best Buy talked me into this one.  Took it on vacation and as a result, not only did I spend half my vacation battling the camera (it would NOT take the picture for whatever reason, just kept beeping at me.  And I've owned a dozen different kinds of cameras, on all technical levels, so I'm not a newbie by any means) BUT I also came home to print out my pictures for my albums and found half of them so incredibly grainy it was as if I'd taken them with a cheap disposable camera.  HORRIBLE.  Returned the blasted thing to Best Buy, talked to someone who knew what they were talking about (who said, "there's no way I would have recommended this model to ANYONE") and upgraded to the Nikon P510.  WELL worth the money to upgrade.  Now if only I could get a do over on my vacation, so I could take decent pictures with the decent camera.  GRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR.  Don't waste your time, money or SANITY on this piece of crap camera.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Barbara Gibbs
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas.  I was so excited, but that excitement faded as I started using the camera.  It drains batteries so fast it's getting to be extremely expensive to use the camera.  Even rechargeable ones are drained within a day or two. While the zoom on it is pretty amazing, that's about all it's good for. Trying to take pictures of my daughter results in blurry pictures and disappointment over those missed moments.  It seems to take forever to reset after you take a picture, so there are many times when I miss getting a shot due to waiting on the camera. I've tried all the settings, and unless the flash is up, anything that isn't zoomed in a lot is blurry. And there are just times when having the flash up makes the pictures worse, so you're left to choose, blurry pictures or super dark pictures.I wouldn't recommend this camera to anybody. I've had better pictures come from a cheap digital camera, and for the price of this camera, I was expecting it to act like it was worth the money. It isn't. Save yourself some hassle and keep looking at a different camera. You'll be thankful you did.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: thecameraqueen
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! it takes wonderful shots that are super clear! the only problem with the camera is it has a slow shutter speed so the pictures turn out blurry, if you use the flash you can get some very cool action shots! i enjoy this camera very much and would recommend it for an amateur photographer and a professional! i hope you give it a shot!

Reviews.Title: really happy
Reviews.Author: David R. Mullins
Reviews.Content: My wife has really enjoyed using this camera.  It has all the features she was looking for including the super zoom.  I might have to get a second one just so I can use it.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: J. Willoughby
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera a few weeks and I don't take pictures every day so I may change my mind a bit over time on this camera.I bought it to replace a Canon Powershot that I really love except for the way it eats batteries.  That camera would say batteries were dead even though they really had half the charge left.  So, I finally gave in to my partner and got this camera so that I'd stop complaining. What happened is I've traded one complaint for another - sigh...So far, I've not had to change the batteries in this camera so it's tons better than the Canon in that regard.  What I don't like, and this is true of almost all the digital point and shoot cameras now, is that there is no view finder.  I was hoping that the larger LCD screen would make it easier to use in bright sunshine, but that is not the case.  I was on a whale watching trip recently and didn't manage to get the whale in any of the still shots I took.  I did manage to get it in one piece of video.  Whether that would have been different had I had a viewfinder, I can't say for sure, but I would have been more comfortable.  However, having said that, I would also say this is a nice camera.If you don't want to spring for the big bucks of an SLR (and I didn't) this camera is reasonably priced and does a good job.  It seems that camera manufacturers have taken pity on us and gotten together on their controls because the controls on this are very similar to my Canon so that made for a much easier learning curve initially.
