However, I'm sure there is much to learn to take full advantage of all the features of this camera.It did take me a while to figure out how to force the flash.  The camera doesn't come with a printed manual - it's on a CD - so if you need to look up how to do things, you'll need a computer handy.  Overall, I think I will really enjoy using this camera once I get past the lack of the viewfinder.  I'll try to remember to update this in a few months after I've had a chance to use the camera more.

Reviews.Title: The Camera that makes taking pictures easy.
Reviews.Author: C.hughson
Reviews.Content: The best camera ever for people who want to aim and shoot. Highly recommend it. User friendly. A picture is a biography of that specific moment in time.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: Mariane Arshad
Reviews.Content: this camera is light fun and easy to use. takes great photo's. wish I had a user manual but not a necessity since I have used digital before.

Reviews.Title: Wow...
Reviews.Author: Wiliker Peña "WZafra7"
Reviews.Content: The camera I'm already using, for me the best camera I ever have. I haven't lamented for buying this camera, love it.

Reviews.Title: Batteries
Reviews.Author: Iresh Iresh
Reviews.Content: The camera takes quality pictures but the downside is that it uses way too many batteries. I was on vacation and had to change the batteries twice in four days. I was using Energizer batteries. For that reason, I would not purchase again.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: helen a.
Reviews.Content: Perfect fit for my hands.  Takes great pictures and is relativly simple to use. Great camera for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: Still learning
Reviews.Author: Sue Blakeley
Reviews.Content: I am still learning all of the things that this camera does but like what I have found so far.  I rated it a 4 star only because it is requiring so much study to learn all it can do.

Reviews.Title: Point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Violeta Martinez
Reviews.Content: Don't let the SLR look of it fool you to think it's an interchangeable lens camera! As a noob in the photography industry I thought that this was going to be the best camera ever! lol I was wrong! although I cannot complain. This camera is way too much for the things that it does! You can pay a buck more ($100) to get a professional one. Either way as a point and shoot it was alright

Reviews.Title: Excellent photographic camera was my Christmas
Reviews.Author: UN MES POR UNA CAMISETA
Reviews.Content: needed a photographic camera and they recommended this model and it is very good, excellent quality and meets all I need at a great price

Reviews.Title: I'll take 2 please.
Reviews.Author: Geek_450
Reviews.Content: In general, it is best to avoid any product that has the word “cool” in its name. Luckily, the Nikon COOLPIX L120 is a rule-breaker! Pretend for a minute that you have all your family together and you want to capture those special family moments with photos. Also pretend that some of those photos will be taken at night or in low light or even outdoors.The Nikon COOLPIX L120 creators have imagined all of those scenarios and created the perfect digital camera to capture them with.The Nikon COOLPIX L120 is so easy to use that the kids will appreciate it as much as mom and dad do. The camera has practical features that make everyday use a breeze, but it also has enough of the high tech features to make everyone happy.The COOLPIX is one of Nikon’s best buys for the budget-conscious family and averages under $250. The camera generally comes with a lens cap, a carrying strap, USB cable and audio/video cable, batteries and the instruction CD. A carrying case is definitely something you will want to purchase when you pick up your camera. Since the camera runs on alkaline batteries, there is no recharger included with the purchase.The COOLPIX L120 has some fun features to make picture-taking simple. It offers a smile recognition software that actually times the photo for the moment that the subject smiles. No more half-smiles or blinking photos for your family albums!The COOLPIX warns of a blink during the photograph and gives you a chance to take another picture immediately. It also has settings for low light, snow and even full dark that give you the option of using a flash to fill dark areas or highlighting just your subject.Nikon’s famous attention to detail really shows on this little camera. Weighing less than 1 pound, it is light as a feather to carry all day at the theme park or beach.The COOLPIX L120 has a range of features that include an extremely powerful zoom and one-touch high definition movie recording. Full stereo sound and 720p movie playback on the 3 inch LCD screen make watching your home movies almost as fun as recording them. The COOLPIX L120 offers technology for the more serious photographer, as well. Two zoom controls and wide angle features allow you to photograph landscapes and big groups of people with ease.The Nikon COOLPIX L120 camera is one of the best small digital cameras on the market for this price range. With its ease-of-use and friendly menus, even the grandparents will appreciate this little beauty. Intelligent features like smile recognition and shake elimination help to make your photos look professional without the big price tag. The COOLPIX is definitely “cool.”

Reviews.Title: Ok for Price

Reviews.Content: This little camera is a real gem....easy to use and figure out, takes wonderful pictures and not too big to carry in my purse!Can now get some real close up shots of the birds at my feeders and great animated shots of my little grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Nice with lots of features
Reviews.Author: Louis Anderson "Neo"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of features and takes very good close ups.  The auto focus works well except when zooming and especially when zooming in the video mode.  Portraits are also very rich with good color and contrast, even in the auto mode.  Battery life seems to be fair.  I use regular batteries as none of the rechargeable batteries seem to hold up as well.  This camera replaced a Kodak digital camera.  The one thing that is a bit hard to get used to is not having a viewfinder.  Without one, it seems that it is more difficult to hold the camera still and is very noticeable when using it in the video mode.  Picture quality will improve with my skills and I'm sure I will be very pleased with the purchase once I have mastered the techniques and features.  Would have liked to have more control over focus.

Reviews.Author: MovieFan77
Reviews.Content: The camera replaces a Canon A-70 which until its display failed, took better focused pictures. Plus the Canon has a viewfinder which helps composition. I cannot rely on the Nikon's display to tell me that I am focused. I have also used a Nikon FE, a Rolleicord, Polaroids and a 4x5 view camera and I know what is necessary for good exposure, focus and composition. I don't blame the L120 for being out of focus or for not using the flash but I feel like I am trying to hack or debug it even after reviewing the instructions. Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I've had it for quite a long time now & it is my favorite. I've had many digital cameras and have always been frustrated by some aspect of them--either they take bad pictures in low light or they're difficult to work with etc. This camera does everything well. It takes great videos & pictures. It takes great pictures in low light & even better in natural light. It gives the user a lot of options to customize their photos & to adjust their photos. There are a lot of easy to use, helpful settings--especially for catching things that are fast moving.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT

Reviews.Content: I baught this camera while i was in iraq because i wanted good quality pictures instead of what i would get from my phone. so worth it

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!

Reviews.Content: It's easy to handle, this in a first for me with point and shoot cameras.  I love this camera, no regrets here!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for a Beginner
Reviews.Author: Net Picker
Reviews.Content: I am not a great photographer and I'm not particularly 'techy'.  I know there are a lot of nice features on my Coolpix that I don't use.  For me, a real novice, this camera is easy to operate and is great for a point-and-shoot photographer.The feature I like best on the Nikon Coolpix L120 is the wide-angle zoom lens.  One of my passions is taking pictures of old barns, silos and old churches.  I ask permission to take pictures as often as possible; however, people aren't home, etc. etc. and if I don't want to miss a great photo opportunity, I will often take pictures from the road and sometimes at great distance.  The zoom lens is great for me.My Coolpix also takes great pictures, but I am not always good at making the picture perfectly straight and sometimes the lighting isn't what I thought it was when I took the picture.  Fortunately for me, a great little program came with my camera which was easily downloaded to my computer.  I can quickly edit my photos by cropping, straightening, adjusting lighting, etc.  Then, I send these photos into my Adobe Elements program for further editing before printing.The only negative comment I have is the size and bulk of this model camera.  It is rather heavy for me to carry on a strap around my neck and it does not fit into my purse.  If I could rate this camera a 4.5 stars, that would better describe my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Best camera I have owned - revised review - new camera turned out to be refirbished
Reviews.Author: Terry Fischer
Reviews.Content: Great pictures. Haven't tried all the different functions, but it is easy to use, with plenty of options to create.An updated review.......I would like to enlighten customers about this camera and the seller, Crawfords Superstore. I started having problems taking pictures during the holidays. I bought this camera in February of 2013. So I contacted Nikon about my issue. They had me send it send to their service center. Waited to head from them, only to find out the one year warranty was not valid and they wanted over $100 to repair. I bought this camera thinking it was brand new from Crawfords Superstore. After finding out I was sold a refurbished camera, I contacted Amazon and the seller. After voicing my displeasure to both on my purchase, I was promised by the seller he would make this right if I sent him the camera and he would send me another camera. After 3 weeks of getting the camera back from the manufacturer and sending it to the seller, I wound up getting a refund and no camera this week. Not very happy on how this went down with the seller, Crawfords Superstore, and the Amazon representative I contacted trying to resolve my problem as soon as possible. I discovered through other reviews, that this was not the first time this seller sold refurbished or used merchandise as new. The last 2 conversations I had with their representative were rude and was lied to about how he was going to resolve this issue satisfactory. It didn't turn out that way, and the Amazon rep that I talked about this problem was hard to understand and she did not have her supervisor contact me as she said she would. This was a very bad experience, and hopefully I will not have to deal other sellers through Amazon taking advantage of Amazon members.

Reviews.Title: Good Price, But No Filters Allowed
Reviews.Author: Bill G.
Reviews.Content: None of the Coolpix cameras allow a screw-on filter.  Most camera enthusiasts know the importance of putting a filter on the lens to protect it from scratches.  Usually a simple UV or skylight filter is used for this.  If you can afford to keep buying low-cost cameras such as the L120, then scratches might not be a problem, but they will impair your photos.Some of the Coolpix cameras appear to have threads on the lens that appear to take a filter.  This very deceptive, because those threads in fact do not allow a filter.  This was confirmed to me via a phone call to Nikon.  The only exception is the Coolpix 7700.  Nikon tech support believes the inclusion of digital filters built into the firmware of the camera are sufficient.  But digital filters will not protect the lens from scratches.  When your lens gets a scratch, you have to send the camera off to Nikon to get it fixed or buy a new camera.In the Nikon camera series, you have to get an SLR $$$$$ to take a filter, the Coolpix 7700 excepted.

Reviews.Title: Tried to like it, but...
Reviews.Author: K. Baldwin
Reviews.Content: One year warranty and product developed issue with lens extending then freezing, up after one year, 8 months. This is my second Coolpix, as the first one, an S640 also quit working within a year. It was still under warranty, fortunately. Love the pictures and the camera functions just fine, but really wish they would "keep working". I keep them in camera bags, indoors, in air conditioning, handled with care. Junky products don't last, and I for one, am tired of junky products that do not last. Hoping Nikon is not resorting to profit over quality.

Reviews.Title: worst customer service ever from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Sasha Marley
Reviews.Content: I never write reviewsBut I feel the need to do it this time.I bought this camera in May 2011, when I finally get my camera I was fascinated, not being a professional or an avid photographer I was able to make great photos. After 3 months of using it regularly, the quality of the photos suddenly diminished; outdoors they were acceptable but indoors they turned dark and blurry and very white if I tried using flash, I had to shoot about 20 photos to be able to get at least one that was OK. Another problem was that the camera was triggered automatically whenever I focused to make the shoot.I thought that perhaps it was just a matter of adjustment and seek for the help of experienced amateur photographs to overcome the problem, yet remained the same, they were not able to fix it, any adjustment they tried simply did not worked. At the time my camera was still protected with warranty so I contacted Nikon explaining the problem, I was asked several questions and had to follow a process in their web site, I was asked to upload photo samples for them to be able to assess the problem. Despite my detailed explanation and pictures that clearly evidence that my photos were not good at all, they only said in one single line that was a problem of adjustment without giving any further explanation, without considering any of my explanation nor the fact that we had tried to adjust the camera several times.Today, after more than one year of not doing anything with the camera, I finally decided to to bring it to a camera repair center, no such explanation was necessary to identify that the problem with the camera was the lens, probably due to home failures turning it difficult to focus and control the vibrations resulting in blurry photo shoots.I do not recommend this product, this was the first product I purchased from Nikon and it will be the last one. A company that does not have the slightest interest in knowing what are the flaws of their products is not worth your money. Not to mention that I have to pay 150USD for changing the lenses when this could have been easily covered by the camera guarantee when I reported the problem.Jannell.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L120--worth it or not??
Reviews.Author: TheReviewer
Reviews.Content: I got the Nikon Coolpix L120 in May 2011. Since then I have used it a lot and feel like I can give a full review. I was kind of disappointed by the zoom. It worked really well up to about 10x, but after that the camera couldn't focus. The camera quality is extremely grainy and washed out. I was really looking forward to something really high quality. The pictures themselves often turn out blurry. This is because the camera sets the shutter speed, and sometimes decides that it should take a whole second to take the picture!!! This really disappointed me and as a result many of the pictures turned out blurry. Also landscape and scenic pictures seem kind of washed out.Some of the things I did like included its viewing screen. It is 3-inches wide, with amazing picture viewing quality. And with the 14.1 megapixel camera, I definitely have gotten some amazing pictures. And like I said, the zoom worked really well at up to 10x, which is pretty good, even if I was really excited about 21x.Overall this camera is at a very affordable price, and is like a slightly higher tech point in shoot, with a cool, sleek body. It's a good camera for a beginning photographer (like me), but in the future, to take higher quality shots I will definitely get something a little more advanced, like a DSLR, but I will hang on to this little guy!Oh, and to answer the question in the title for my review, I would say this camera is worth it for beginner photographers, but if you are more advanced or even professional and are looking for something a little higher tech than a point and shoot, but lower tech than a DSLR, then I would keep looking. It doesn't have many of the features higher grade cameras do, and if you are used to working with those higher grade cameras, you will find yourself extremely frustrated with this camera.Hope this helped!!

Reviews.Title: Great supplement for an SLR
Reviews.Author: Laurel "Crowning Laurel"
Reviews.Content: I spent an inordinate amount of time trying to find the perfect tag-along camera for my bulky SLR. I'm going on an out of country trip, and as much as I love my big camera, it can be a hassle, and honestly looks far too touristy for my taste.The L120 is the perfect in-between for those who don't want a giant camera, but also don't want to compromise quality with a pocket camera.It has great zoom, works well in low-light, and hasn't let me down while chasing my 2 year old son who just won't sit still for a good picture.

It has surprised me with the amazing quality.  I especially love the results I got playing with the exposure. I wasn't interested in the video feature and it is actually not very good, but the camera features are awesome! I highly recommend it.  I love Amazon too (o=

Reviews.Title: Great for stationary shots, but limited in action
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: I've taken some beautiful photos indoors and out with this camera.  As light goes down, artifacts (picture's overall blurriness) becomes a major issue on auto mode.  I have to use the flash when shooting in auto in low light.The preset settings are limited.  I had a $100 point and shoot Canon that had more settings.  There are major issues with blurry pictures of moving objects.  The only setting that works in high resolution is pets, and even that is far from perfect.  The continuous burst mode works great for sporting and action sequences, but there are a high rate of artifacts and I would only recommend in high light settings.Video works great and is truly 720 HD.  The auto focus is great when you're in a hurry to start a shoot. The only drawback is that you can hear the zoom lens if adjusted during a quiet shoot.Would I buy this camera again?  Not at full price, but for a 21X zoom HD video camera, it was worth two benjamins.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a beginner
Reviews.Author: Staci Cazenave
Reviews.Content: I needed a new camera but I didn't want a basic digital camera...something with a bit of extra features. This is the one for me. Zoom is great, easy to use and I get great pics. Very easy to initially set-up and after reading the manual, I find that I am getting better shots than I would by using some or all of the advanced functions/features of this camera. Still learning my way around it but I think this was a great purchase for me .

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jon "Jon"
Reviews.Content: Was going on a once in a lifetime trip to Thailand and Cambodia and wanted to be able to show my family back home what I saw and experienced... and I wanted to record it with something better than your typical pocket digi camera.This camera ended up being perfect.  I took some amazing pics.... in less than 3 months I took over 1000 pictures.  I especially loved the Continuous Sport function... takes 8-15 rapid fire pictures.... great for capturing motion... especially cool motion like a Muay Thai fight or a tiger running through a pool of water to pounce another tiger.I cannot think of any cons... good camera and easy to use.  I'm very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good zoom, yet compact
Reviews.Author: Koen
Reviews.Content: I have bought 2 of these already and am very happy with them. They have a good zoom equivalent to a 300mm lens and yet compact and no need to change lenses. I like the date imprint function that i use for holiday pictures. I like the HD video recording.

Reviews.Title: Best. Camera. Ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Hwaller1987
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd Nikon that I have owned!  My mother talked me into buying this model.  I am so glad that she did!! It is absolutly wonderful.  I feel like a professional1 =^D

Reviews.Title: BATTERY COVER
Reviews.Author: Mary Mahon
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased the Nikon L120 and although the picture quality was good the battery compartment door is flimsy.  Very hard to close and latch down with the batteries in.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L120
Reviews.Author: G. Puscizna "beach wanderer"
Reviews.Content: A gift. The reviews received from the recipient were great. This product met all their needs and wants. It easy to use and transport.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Great condition and fast shipping. Good communication  also! I was scared at first with it being used. But it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Carol Dieckman
Reviews.Content: Love my camera.  It is so easy to use and the pictures turn out great, colors are wonderful. Thanks for wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: César Alcázar
Reviews.Content: Recomiendo 100% al vendedor. El producto me llegó en perfectas condiciones y en el tiempo que lo necesitaba. Realmente era lo que esperaba y mucho mas. Espero seguir comprando a éste proveedor en muchas ocasiones mas

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: VA Reader
Reviews.Content: My husband and I gave this camera to ourselves for Christmas and have already fallen in love! It is so easy to use and works well in a variety of settings.  It takes great nighttime pictures and continuous shots.  The zoom feature is outstanding and takes crisp, clear pictures from many yards away.  We are very happy with our purchase!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: beccoble
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty easy to use it is not really a point and shoot you need to know how to use it I had to contact someone that had one like this. The pictures are very blurry if you do not have the flash on. I do not like this at all. But it takes very good pictures when you have the flash up.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: Juan C. Guerreo Moya
Reviews.Content: This camera is just the result of a company who cares about quality, market targets and solid products. If you want to compare this camera vs another brand you'll probably find thousand of points in your favor.. For me it turns out that this is the best camera I've ever order after my all life camera MAMIYA Professional with double focus.. The optical zoom is impressive and the quality picture resolution is something that amazing.. I'm not a pro and I feel like one everytime I take a picture. I recommend you to buy the extra memory cartridge in case you want to record videos. the navigation menu is easy to use. I'm very happy with my product.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Jungle
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice and easy to use camera. But it only has 720P video recording capability. I am a little disappointed. Zoom range is BIG. Zooming speed control is a little too rough, not precise enough. Overall it's a well made camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use for great pictures!
Reviews.Author: Tammy Meyers
Reviews.Content: I am a novice at photography and my main subjects are outdoors: birds, scenery, sometimes the occasional family get together. My new Nikon is replacing a larger and bulkier camera. It is easy to use and takes great pictures. I love the zoom on it, it really gets close to the action. It is lighter weight than my previous camera. I love the option of no flash. My previous camera would pop up and flash even though I had set it not to flash. The menus are easy to navigate and set your options. A great camera at a great price.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Camera For The Money
Reviews.Author: Stephen
Reviews.Content: I have given this camera a five star rating for what this camera is, a fully automatic SLR-type camera. If I would compare it with its more expensive brethern it would rate fewer stars. With that in mind the auotmatic function works for me. The exposure is on target. The 21X lens is fantastic for this price range. Also, the L120 takes AA batteries. That is a huge plus for me as they can be bought anywhere, even overseas. One can buy rechargeables and save some money. Ergonomically, this camera feels good in my hands. I would recommend this camera at its price point as it seems that these digital cameras only last a few years and repairing them is way expensive when they die. To me, it does not make sense to spend hundreds of dollars on a camera that is not easily repairable, becomes a relic in a short amount of time and becomes a throw-away.

Reviews.Title: disappointing, Got this from upgrading old Fuji camera.. but has problems in 1 month Zooming.
Reviews.Author: Joe Wehler
Reviews.Content: disappointing, Got this from upgrading old Fuji camera.. but has problems in 1 month Zooming, it zooms all the way out and stuck, the camera freezes afterward. Had it repaired by Nikon 2 Times, the first time it took more then 7 weeks waiting on parts! I would buy a Cannon next time or go back to my old Fuji (inexpensive, but good value).

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: C. Nelson Merrell
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera! It has everything I could have asked for in a small point-and-shoot. To be so compact, the full range of features offered are incredible. I would not hesitate to recommend this product to anyone. In fact, I already have.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: ALIUKS
Reviews.Content: great pics, great zoom, great everything..It is an amazing camera. This is my second nikon coolpix and it is everything I expected to...

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: This Nikon COOLPIX L120 is a great camera for anyone.  As a senior I find it very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Leaves You Fustrated!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews about this product, and I am a loyal Nikon customer, until now.  I have a DSLR Nikon D5100, loved the camera, but the size was uncomfortable.  So I went with the Nikon L120.  Big mistake.  This camera takes a good picture if you are a statue and never move.  The blur of every action picture, left me way to fustrated.  If I used the flash, everything went ok. But the flash is hardly necessary with every shot, and I have an active 4 year old, and 2 year old nephew.  This camera does not work for action pictures.  If you are steady enough, good luck I think everything will go okay.  But I'm used to being able to grab the camera and not worry about that.  Sorry Nikon, you have left me way to fustrated.  I have went elsewhere for my camera shopping.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Wanderlei Bortoleto
Reviews.Content: Hi,Fantastic camera. I used to have a Sony DSC-H55 and they are out of comparison.Great pictures, ease to use, batteries last long.I recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Fil
Reviews.Content: Nice automatic camera.  Easy to use takes nice photos.  Picture button sometimes is slow and you click and it doesn't take the photo. Action setting is great.  Takes a lot of snaps in short time.  Video camera part works nice. All and all pretty satisfied.  Great camera for the price!

Reviews.Title: NICE! NICE! NICE!
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: Amazing Camera for the price. Pictures crystal nice features. A few things could be improved but then again, want a better camera pay more and buy one. This camera is super nice for its price. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L120
Reviews.Author: Derek J. Mcgowan
Reviews.Content: We previously had a Canon Powershot digital camera.  I spent most of my life using a SLR camera but my wife cannot cope with the intricacies of this technology.  Hence our first digital camera was the Canon Powerpoint. We decided we wanted a replacement camera with a good telephoto lens and after doing much research we decided on the Nikon Coolpix L120.  Wow what a camera!  For its price and features it is amazing.  We take pictures of birds at our farm using max range on the telephoto and even though we don't have the most stable hands we are able to get wonderfully clear shots.  Its controls are easy to use and it compares very favorably with more expensive camera's.  It takes good photographs in poor light without using the flash.  I can only say that my wife and I are thrilled with the clarity and quality of photographs.  We would strongly recommend it to others seeking a wider capability of telephoto lens and flexible controls for special shots.  It is not a small handbag camera which is desired by many folk these days, but it is well worth the effort to lug around on vacations and family visits etc.  On the superficial side, it is a very attractive and sophisticated looking camera - we got the red one which has a particularly smart look to it. Great camera for its price!

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera!!
Reviews.Author: retyck
Reviews.Content: This camera has amazing quality and has been working great since I got it ! It is such an easy camera to use for someone who wants a DSLR but doesn't think they will be able to handle it! This camera works amazing and I would recommend it to anyone who is just looking for a great camera that is not too professional.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: naran
Reviews.Content: Its very compact and very good for normal usage. The photo quality is good. Has good video camera as well

Reviews.Title: Best Low end camera I have seen for the price
Reviews.Author: amazainiak "amazainiak"
Reviews.Content: I own 2 slr cameras and wanted one more portable yet retained an acceptable quality.  This met every expectation actually it exceeded my hopes very easy to use both with still pictures and video quality.  Great product would highly recomend

Reviews.Title: Great Upgrade from a plain point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: R. Sainer "Rod"
Reviews.Content: This is a super easy to use camera packed with many great features. I photograph insects and mountains so the super macro and 20X zoom are perfect for me. The video is great as well. I love how you can zoom while recording! I highly recommend this camera for any novice photographer.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix Nikon L110
Reviews.Author: Chapt1
Reviews.Content: The camera is fantastic..it takes awesome pics and the videos are superb!  The only discouraging feature is not being able to take dual sports pics at once.  It take multi-pics, however, it seems like it is too fast when taking the shots, therefore the subject pictured seems to only move 5/100 of an inch at a time.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: jgilreath
Reviews.Content: This camera is one of the easiest high quailty cameras that I have ever owned. Straight of the box I was taking pictures within in minutes.  Great price at Amazon too!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: DENNIS
Reviews.Content: Great camera, full of features you would expect from Nikon.  Only drawback would be in low light conditions you need to be careful to make sure that the camera focus locks on your subject, sometimes the picture can be out of focus. Close up photography is fantastic. Zoom really brings in distant objects with great clarity.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: eric.
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera especially for the price! Any other cameras I have tried, that have the same quality and features are about double the price and aren't really as comfortable to use. Very Good Product!

Reviews.Title: Wow! Nice Camera!
Reviews.Author: Michael Aebegast
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use right out of the box!  Some of the features are much easier to understand then my big Nikon digital 5000 camera.  The styling is awesome looking (Red!) and the camera is very light and compact for superior photos in a pinch! What can I say about the images!!!  Hello!!  Nikon quality of course.....Awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Good, but not great camera
Reviews.Author: John Beowulf "beowulfborealis"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so I didn't have to lug 5 lbs of D200 around with me all the time.  It weights about as much as a deck of cards.  I don't think it will last long given the plastic, but if you are looking for a point and shoot system that will do video, this camera will work.I don't like the vibration reduction.  They should call it "image destruction" since you get nice grainy shots and a pic killing 1 second delay using it.  I switch it off and get nice clear shots and fast reaction time.  Using the camera is pretty easy once you get used to the layout.  Nikon wants you to basically pick your type of shot (night, pet, fireworks etc) from a menu, and then they set the camera up for optimum conditions.  But that is annoying.  I find more advanced Nikon cameras easy enough to use, I just don't like the weight.  I would call it an intermediate camera from the $100 point and shoot crowd to the price point of the $500 SLRs out there.I would go into a camera store and examine one before buying it to be sure of what you are getting.  There are some fine cheap digitals that fit in a pocket out there, and you can't beat the cheap SLRs either.  It is a good time to be a photographer, for sure.

Reviews.Title: Good, if not inside
Reviews.Author: Mary Kuehn
Reviews.Content: This camera takes excellent pictures as long as you are not inside.  Otherwise, the pictures are blurry and streaking and very grainy. I know that you have to push the button down halfway first to focus, but this camera did not work inside at all.  Horrible pictures.  I read all the reviews before I purchased and I'm thinking I may have just got a defective camera.  I returned it for something else.

Reviews.Title: over all performance
Reviews.Author: J. Deason "pepsiman"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional with camera's but I've used them for about 35 years, since I started using my Dad's 35MM split frame and developing the film myself. Now, The Nikon COOLPIX L120 14.1 MP camera is very easy to work and use and has that Professional feel about it. It takes great photo's and focus is fast.  The only draw back about it that I do not like is that it uses AA batteries and if you do not get the RIGHT kind, than the camera will not work at all, but than again, you can always get batteries where ever you happen to be and take extra's with you while traveling or out for the day.

Reviews.Title: No good
Reviews.Author: Robert1944
Reviews.Content: Outside you can't see the image on the screen,so you can't see what you are shooting. Pictures are sometimes blurry even on automatic focus. The zoom lens goes to fast, so you got to go back and forth until you luck out. IF YOU ONLY WANT TO TAKE PHOTOS INSIDE WITH EVERYONE STANDING STILL, THEN IT'S OK. OTHER WISE IT'S USELESS AND A WASTE OF A COUPLE HUNDRED.

Reviews.Title: Birthday gift
Reviews.Author: labor leader
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday gift for my sister.  She had specifically asked for this camera and appears to be quite happy with it.  If it were me I would not like the fact that if operates on AA batteries instead of a rechargable, but, that is the reason she liked it.

Reviews.Title: Beyond awesome!
Reviews.Author: Theophilus
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I had the previous model purchased back in 2009 and I still do. This one has improved on what was already a great camera. If you are looking for a decent priced semi-professional camera, this is it. It has awesome zoom and the 14.1 megapixel is a plus. I love being able to take pictures in situations where smaller digital cameras cannot (for example in a graduation). The zoom allows you to get close pictures without the grainy images. I should mention that this is not a typical fit in your pocket camera. However, its size is what makes it stand the middle ground between small cameras and the professional DSR. I really enjoy it versatility. I have now taken pictures in just about every mode and they come out great, even at night in Las Vegas. The sports mode should also get honourable mention. In short, it's a great buy.

Reviews.Title: great nikon
Reviews.Author: newhigherlevel
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera i have ever put my hands on i like it better than a canon rebel i had smaller and better features.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Karthik
Reviews.Content: Great camera for great price.I loved the outcome of image even though it has 14MP, Nikor lenses are great quality.I loved the camera.I was able to take picture of full moon with great quality.Indoor picture with flash is also not bad at all.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L120 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 21x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD (Red)
Reviews.Author: RITA
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, responsibility and seriousnes, Impeccable purchase good serviceQuality of image and all the complete accessories Recommended to the community Amazon

Reviews.Title: Takes excellent pictures
Reviews.Author: Ikram Chaudhry "Insulin pump user"
Reviews.Content: I have only had the camera for about a month and I love it. The pictures are clear and you don't have to work very hard to use the camera effectively.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME. I LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Katherine B.
Reviews.Content: I have received my camera, and I really love it. Even thought I did not know that it works by AA batteries, its quality is excellent.It includes strap, LR6/L40 (AA size) alkaline battery x 4, USB cable, Audio video cable, lens cap, software CD-ROM, quick start guide, warranty and registration card.I will recommend it to my friends for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: good, I love it
Reviews.Author: amazon
Reviews.Content: 21x zoom is very nice. good looking camera. very satisfied.All the functions work well. Attached batteries are good, they last very long time. it is comfortable to hold.One thing that is not good is that I have to buy rechargeable batteries for this camera. But I love it. really love it.

Reviews.Title: not good, not bad
Reviews.Author: kubrakadir
Reviews.Content: When i bought this camera I expected better.. But it is not. Its flash button doesn't work since first day. We have to hit it to make it work. Also the pictures are not clear enough.. 'f I had a chance to exchange this camera now I would.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: Disappointed. Did my homework and thought I'd found the perfect camera for me. I had been using a Canon Powershot S5is (8 mega pixel). Planned to use this camera on my "Bucket List" trip up the eastern Sierras. No way! Better pictures with the Canon. The Nikon L120 photos are fuzzy, even when taken in the Auto mode. Expected more from Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: T. Shields
Reviews.Content: We flog such cameras in the appraisal business using them pretty hard. I have an old coolpix from about 2004...it was getting difficult to work properly but it does still work and has never been in the shop.  I like the look and feel and hopefully it will be as good as the last one.

Reviews.Title: Great Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Dan Tidwell
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for a couple of weeks and am impressed with the ease of use and the quality of the shots. Granted the easy auto leaves something to be desired, but the other modes, portrait, night landscape, pet, etc have all produced wonderful pictures. I haven't really used the video feature enough to form an opinion on it. I have a camcorder for video, so that feature is not important to me. If you're looking for a camera that's easy to use right out of the box with a great zoom, you can't go wrong with the L120.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: ADKer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to replace an older point & shoot, Kodak EasyShare C875.  I'm returning the Nikon CoolPix because the flash will not fire in the Easy Mode setting, regardless of lighting condition and despite the flash being in the upright position.  The literature indicates the flash should be operative in Easy Mode.  The flash did work in Auto Mode.  I am returning this camera.  I Googled this issue on the Web and it appears this failure is not an isolated defect.  Consequently, I will be looking at other manufacturers for a replacement camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon 120 Camera
Reviews.Author: gd
Reviews.Content: Our old Fuji digital camera gave up the ghost recently. We are well pleased with the performance of the Nikon we just acquired. It's easy to use and takes excellent photos.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've ever used
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I've researched a lot of Cameras. The first time I've held this one in my hands I knew I didn't want any other. I love how it fits in my hand.It's not slippery like other ones I've held.I like that it is more on the heavier side.It cuts down on the shaking.In the week that I've owned it I already took about 1000 Pictures with it.The original batteries are still going strong.Only half empty.I don't understand why this one has any bad reviews at all.The few pictures that were bad were my fault for either choosing the wrong setting or shaking.I think people just need to look at their own wrong doings before bashing this Camera.Sometimes all it takes is reading the manual and using a Tripod. Choosing the right setting is always a good Idea.I used this Camera right out of the box.I haven't tried out the Video Mode yet,as I have a Video Camera already.I love all the fantastic features of this Camera.I'm still working my way through all of the setting as there are plenty of.But I've taken some incredible pictures.This Camera is one of the best out there.Especially for the price.The only Con is that the red and bronze versions of this Camera are much more expensive than the black one.On the B&H; professional website they are all the same price.If you want to upgrade from a point and shoot Camera,but don't want to spend a fortune on a DSLR,buy the Nikon Coolpix L120Best investment I've ever made.

Reviews.Title: Nikon
Reviews.Author: kak
Reviews.Content: This camera is decent for the price. It runs through batteries farily quickly-especially if they are the rechargeable ones. The zoom and screen are of a good quality. It is reliable as long as you have extra batteries. The software that is included is also very easy to manage and use.

Reviews.Title: Biggest headache ever!!!
Reviews.Author: Daniel M. Helm
Reviews.Content: As a photographer (amateur) for over 35 years, it is with great regret that I have to write about how poor this product is. When I began using Nikon cameras in 1978, Nikon had a great reputation and a great product. Not any more, if this product is any indication. I bought the L120 liking the features and the good price. It stopped working, and after three times of trying to fix it, and finally being given a 'refurbished' camera to replace my new one, and it didn't work, I'm done with any expectation of resolution. Back to Sony. By the way, when I tried to offer Nikon a video of the latest epic fail of a camera to work, I had to remind then that I was using a 10 year old Sony.

Reviews.Title: False Advertisement
Reviews.Author: David Schimpf
Reviews.Content: Electrobrands claims they do not sell refurbished products. I found it odd that the camera came in an all white box. I called Nikon and confirmed with that all remanufactured items come in non-nikon boxes. I called the company and spoke with Stanley, who would not put Terry on the phone. Apparently she's the one who makes the decisions. Next, I called my lawyer....

Reviews.Title: Hate this camera.
Reviews.Author: Huddy's Mama
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. It's just a giant version of every other digital camera out there. Save up another $100 and get a canon rebel.

Reviews.Title: new camera
Reviews.Author: temmy wolford
Reviews.Content: I think this was a very good buy I believe me and my new camera are going to be very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Item for a Starter and Awesome Experience!
Reviews.Author: Herrol Mora ""nemo""
Reviews.Content: I have bought this Camera because I love photography and started with the regular automatic small cameras, but wanted something else. This camera is awesome and featured with a lot of different options to have the best of your pictures. I would like to have better zoom to reach better angles of nature (I live in Costa Rica) and animals. I am very happy with my camera and now my pictures are getting better and better. Now, I want more... but still will remain with Nikon. I'll recommend this for all starters in photography and actually my little sister (20) already started with mine.

Reviews.Title: Nikon COOLPIX L120 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 21x NIKKOR Wide-Angle Optical Zoom Lens and 3-Inch LCD
Reviews.Author: map
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for all those fans of photography and want to start big, one of laas qualities s highlight is the zoom and the different modes of photography adapted to many situations and places

Reviews.Title: A WONDERFULL PRODUCT!
Reviews.Author: famind
Reviews.Content: This product it's wonderfull! I think that this product give a GREATS PICTURES FOR MY AND MY FRIENDS! RECOMENDED IT 100 PERCENT!

Reviews.Title: nikon dose it again
Reviews.Author: horace ryan
Reviews.Content: great little travle camera,after a day of carrying the l-120 around no sore neck and no bag of lens to worry with got eveything in one package.no muss no fuss if you gotta cuss call us LOL.

Reviews.Title: First Digital
Reviews.Author: Pecanpie
Reviews.Content: Nice looking camera, arrived in one piece.  The instructional manual was somewhat vague consequently I haven't figured out how to use the wide angle or telescopic options.  Also wasn't sure when the camera was in focus but in all fairness I barely know how to operate any digital camera.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: fishcop
Reviews.Content: I have not had the camera long enough to know everything about it.  It is good so far.  Everything we wanted.

Reviews.Title: Digital Lover
Reviews.Author: Dgital Lover
Reviews.Content: This camera arrived on time and came as advertised.  This is a great digital camera and I definitely recommend it for people who don't really want to set the camera themselves. The menu is easy to understand and it takes beautiful pictures in just about any mode.  If you are interested in a upgrade to your current point and shoot, this is a great choiceNikon D5100 16.2MP CMOS Digital SLR Camera with 18-55mm f/3.5-5.6 AF-S DX VR Nikkor Zoom Lens

Reviews.Title: ***DO NOT buy this if you have kids!!***
Reviews.Author: MommyD
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it is a Nikon so I thought I could trust that it would be good.  This camera is such a bummer!  Even in front of a large window, this camera takes blurry photos.  The very slightest movement by a child (and what child sits totally still??) results in a terrible, hazy image.  I really only use the camera outside; I rely on my phone to take indoor pictures and they turn out much nicer. Nikon customer service told me to make sure to take pictures with more natural light or use the flash; such genius advice!!  My next camera will be a Canon.  Do not buy this one!

Reviews.Title: pic click perfect!
Reviews.Author: Neha
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in July 2011 and I am quite satisfied with this product. It does the jobs well. Pictures look perfect in designated mode. I prefer lift n click type cams rather than those for which we need to adjust lenses , and some settings.. Few pros n cons are belowpros: 1) lift n click, no need for setting  2) light weight  3) picture quality is fine ( Not like DSLR) 4) Nice zoom 4) Video Shooting is good 5) Many picturing modes are providedcons: 1) Batteries - It needs 4 AA size batteries 2) Product doesnt come with these batteries and memory card. We need to purchase it separately. 3) Picture quality is not like DSLR neither it is like Nikon P500, its just below that level. But good  4) Need to click photos by seeing through big screen which took battery life.Well Thats it.If in future, if I did photography course and if I become faster in adjustment of lenses and effects, I will not buy this product. I will go for DSLR.But this camera is really good when you need pictures within a second.. Lift and Click Click.. :D

Reviews.Title: Good camera, slow learning curve...
Reviews.Author: Monte
Reviews.Content: I paid big bucks for a red one of these. Gave it to her for Christmas. She tries to use it in easy auto mode, the flash doesn't work and the pictures are fuzzy. Switch to auto mode much better but this camera definitely does not get good reviews for ease of use. CR loved this camera. I still like my Kodaks better.

Reviews.Title: Great entry level digital SLR camera
Reviews.Author: J. Yonkunas
Reviews.Content: This camera was recommended by a friend, and I have to agree that it hits the mark for an entry to mid level digital SLR camera.Great features, excellent LCD quality for post-shot screening. It is budget friendly, and takes better pictures than my old one, which is all I wanted.It is definitely worth the extra hundred dollars over the compact models in my opinion, the zoom is amazing!Good buy for entry level photographers, I tested out the macro settings, and was blown away!Sport continuous shooting is O.K. But I cannot work out how to get it to shoot more than 20 continuous shots at once.Auto portrait mode is interesting and good if you only have use of one hand. Auto portrait will take photos by itself when it recognizes a face.Not something I would use often but interesting enough.Motion video recording is O.K. quality, but not the main reason I bought this camera, so not really something to gripe about.Be sure to get at least a 30Mb/s class 10 SD-HC card for taking video though.This camera has and will continue to get a whole lot of use from me.My best purchase this year!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: safe
Reviews.Content: Don't know much about cameras, so as long as it is simple to use and takes great fotos, I am happy!  And this was a wonderful adquisition.

Reviews.Title: Nikon disappoints
Reviews.Author: STACY Sookoo
Reviews.Content: Long story short, I thought being a Nikon this camera would have been great. It boasts the best pics and HD videos. Well, My Sony DSC-S700 is far superior to this. Pics are just ok, and video playback is extremely pixelized and poor. I will never make the mistake of purchasing Nikon again!

Reviews.Title: Pressure Crack
Reviews.Author: Johanna Brinkman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my point-and-shoot carry-everywhere-with-me camera.  I have other more expensive cameras, but wanted something lightweight and good quality for everything else.  I kept the camera in my purse, which I do not abuse, and within one month had a pressure crack. I took it to the camera store and was told that these cameras cannot take any abuse because pressure cracks occur, which are not covered under warranty.  To fix is almost the cost of a new one, so that's what I'm going to do.  I'm headed back to Canon.  I should have never left.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS OR ANY NIKON!!
Reviews.Author: SL10
Reviews.Content: Nikon AND Amazon do NOT stand behind the products they sell. My husband purchased this for me as a present. When I began to use it and realized it was defective, it was already past the 30 day return window. A thin green line appears down the middle of some pictures. Almost all of the pictures, once printed, show shadowy lines through the entire picture. From my "google research" only, it appears to be some kind of bad sensor. I called Amazon, they wouldn't help me. I called Nikon and they would only repair the product IF I paid for shipping, packaging, and insurance to send it away for 2-3 weeks. We did not spend over $200 on a brand new camera to have to pay more for it to be repaired to end up with a refurbished camera at best, that I could have bought for around $100 elsewhere. This is ridiculous and the furthest thing from customer service I have seen in a long time. Someone needs to take responsibility and show that they actually care about the customer and quality of their product. As far as I'm concerned, both companies just lost a customer unless someone will help me.Bottom line: Nikon sent Amazon a defective camera. Amazon sold it to me. Neither is willing to do anything to help me except make me pay more money for an inferior product. So just save yourself, and buy something else, somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: Ugh...biggest waste of money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera I was in love with it. I played with it in a store but bought it online for a better price deal. However, when I spent more time playing with it and all the modes and settings it was clear this camera was awful.I had read so many bad reviews of this camera and how the pictures came out blurry all the time and how slow the shutter speed was, but I didn't care. Well, I should have because every photo I took was blurry. I maybe got a handful of usable photographs for my collection. I am very disappointed by this product and would never recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: it stinks
Reviews.Author: GAILR
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon coolpix L120 after hearing good things about it. I took about 50 test shots. Half were blurry and the other half  had washed  out or incorrect color. The shots taken in my dining room showed a yellow wall. My wall is off white. The more zoom I used the worse the photo got.The 720 video looked as if it was shot in slow motion. I could not return this camera fast enough.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Josephine A. Desjardins "Jo"
Reviews.Content: I haven't used this camera much since I received it, but what I have doen with it is proving to be great. The pictures are crisp and you can do alot with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Overall good
Reviews.Author: Seimandi
Reviews.Content: Great camera.. definitively good zoom! good video record quality it works wonderful with the zoom it auto-focus really quick and almost doesnt go out of focus at all while recording video..plenty of set to take pictures... good camara....cons: battery AA product... goto buy some good rechargeable 2500+ battery to keep this ruiningy i recomend 2 sets of 4 AA batterys

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: Daniel Keys "A Hermit with a pen"
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research and found this camera had recieved rave reviews all over the place from very reliable sources. I was excited to recieve my camera but quickly began to hate it. Every single picture is blurry! Regardless of settings...everything is blurry! I have a better chance of winning the lottery 3 times than actually getting a non-blurry picture with this camera. The final straw was yesterday, Christmas day. Although I knew it would happen, I took pictures of my kids and family opening presents, etc. Every single picture was blurry. I hate this camera.

Reviews.Title: Absolute Disappointment!!!
Reviews.Author: Njensen
Reviews.Content: I second the review by Soapy's Mom. This camera is an absolute disappointment. Did all the research, it got great ratings and reviews....then what's the problem??? Every shot is blurry no matter what mode you use. Flash on or off, terrible shots. I just had a baby and the early shots turned out terrible. Back to using my compact Kodak that I hated before I bought this one. I seem to have bad luck with my camera purchase regardless of how hard I look to find a great one. It's not at all what I expected out of a Nikon. I am returning this camera.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: texaswalker
Reviews.Content: this camera is just wonderful going on and adventure out west this summer and coudnt of chose a better camera this camera has everything in a compact area found this camera to be great for an ameture like me

Reviews.Title: Buy cheap, buy twice
Reviews.Author: Mr. Brad Bauer
Reviews.Content: Im absolutely livid with myself for buying this camera.  I've gone through a divorce and been left with nothing (including the loss of my SLR cameras) and this was the one I could afford that promised to be the most similar to the SLRs.  I have a 2 year old son, and armed with only this camera, I have missed documenting the last 6 months of his time with me.  Every picture is blurred-- granted he's 2 and moves a lot, but even the slightest movement by the photographer blurs the image.  Blurred.  EVERYTHING.  I wish I had saved up and bought something decent.  I will take my loss on this one for an Amazon gift card, but DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.  *sigh*

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Doctor Kenneth Noisewater
Reviews.Content: I bought this the Coolpix L120 for my wife for Christmas. I was intrigued by the optical zoom and the Nikon name. I am familiar with Nikon's SLRs, and have used L110s at work.First, the L120s body feels plastic and flimsy in comparison to the L110. Not sure what the difference is or why that would be, but the L110 seems sturdy and well put together. The L120 feels like a dressed up camera from some brand you've never heard of but found for a really good deal at a flea market.Second, to its credit the L120 performed admirably outside. The images were crisp and clear with good color balance. The L110s I've used were done so primarily outdoors, so this is not a surprise.Third, the L120 performed horribly and inconsistently indoors. For example, sitting at my kitchen table I set the camera to auto. I then snapped two pictures, one after the other. One looked fine, but the other had a horrible yellow tint to it. No flash was used for either photograph, the same settings were used, and there were no lighting changes, just click and click. What that's about is beyond me.Fourth, as mentioned above the L120 performed inconsistently. I took a series of photographs of my wife with the L120. Some were focused and clear, others were slightly blurry, and others looked as if I Photoshopped my wife into the picture. Other photos were grainy, much like those produced by my 7-year old, 3 megapixel Sony point and shoot that cost roughly 1/3 of the L120.Fifth, other complaints include an awkward menu system, a "hidden" stabilization option in that my wife found it, but it certainly isn't in an obvious place and could not be found by me without looking in the manual, a lack of something as basic as a manual option, use of weird terminology in "sports" mode menu, and probably a few other things I've forgotten.Overall, I would not recommend this camera. It's not worth the money - even at Amazon prices. I am entirely disappointed. I don't understand how a company like Nikon would attach their name to such a subpar product. The presence of a 21x optical zoom does not make up for other, glaring shortcomings. Needless to say we're sending this one back.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE ITTTTT!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: R. Laycock
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to buy a good cheap nikon camera, buy the L120! its very lightweight has a quarter inch tripod "jack" thing (pretty sure its the quarter inch one...its the one pretty much all are equiped with) the quality is DIVINEEEE the pictures are amazing!!!! i am giving this camera 4 stars, why didnt i give it 5 u ask? well i would give it 5 stars if the lens had some threads to put some lens's filters lens hoods yada yada yada but you can get a lens adapter wich fits snugly on the lens and has some threads that let you put some on it heres the link [...]welp thats my review! i HIGHLY recomend u get it!peace out!

Reviews.Title: excellent product
Reviews.Author: Melvin N. Racho
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, lightweight, nice comfort grip, and excellent features. Just don't forget to remove the lens cap before turning it on.

Reviews.Title: ok camera
Reviews.Author: cat_cattus
Reviews.Content: it does take nice pictures of objects that stay still. inside picture quality is so-so as well as quality of portraits. the focus is slow that makes fast shutter speed useless as soon as all pictures of people, kids or animals turn out to be blurry.

Reviews.Title: Built is not Nikon quality but good for price you paid
Reviews.Author: HarryN
Reviews.Content: First they took very long time to ship this camera (stocked item). NIce cute camera one step above compact camera. Too small for man's hand but fit some female hands (we are Japanese). LCD screen is big enough and all control are easy to use. 21Xzoom is not easy to use (7X will be normal use). Buit quality is so so consider Nikon name. Grip rubber is floating (you feel every time to take a picture) meter1lic color is some what uneven. Well this bargen price based with those dunction and picture quality I would not complain.

Reviews.Title: Make sure you can get a refund if you buy it
Reviews.Author: Marie Kerby "fabie"
Reviews.Content: "With Nikon's Sport Continuous Shooting mode, this camera takes photos continuously and in quick succession to capture fast moving objects" We captured me dancing and it was awesome to see 8 different frames of me take n within a second; Problem is that the quality of the pictures turns out really poor. We used the beach scene  to take photos of me in the water; but the photos turned out to look as if they were shooped. The water came out way too bright.It's excellent for macro photography.The zoom also goes far, but not always the best qualityAlso, the lens gets dirty real fast. We took nice pics outdoor under great conditions, but can't use them cause the pics came out  looking really greyish. I think it might be cause of the lens being dirty, but I never had that problem with any of my kodak cameras.I'm either gonna go cannon or kodak from now on.

Reviews.Title: very good camera but no manual mode
Reviews.Author: cyril
Reviews.Content: Very good camera, good video/image quality. BUT i was so sad to see that there is NO manual mode.I hope that a new firmware will solve this...

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto
Reviews.Author: Adan
Reviews.Content: Esta camara es excelente, ya habia comprado anteriormente una version anterior a L110, pero esta supera en mi expectativa. Si eres un usuario normal  (no de aquellos profesionales en fotografia) y quisquilloso como yo, esta camara cubrira tus expectivas.

Reviews.Title: its a okay camera but its not atrue cool pix camera they lie
Reviews.Author: dogg 40
Reviews.Content: takes good pics but its not a true cool pix camera i seen cool pix and this is not a cool pix camera why they say it is i dont know you cant make the shirt on aperson be in color and rest of the pic be in black and white i seen cool pix cameras that do that this dont do it

Reviews.Title: Warning
Reviews.Author: severo
Reviews.Content: L120 is a point & shot camera , NOT a SLR, have a 11mm Sensor . L120 is NOT a pro camera, is a normal point & shoot with a lot of zoom !

Reviews.Title: BAD...DO NOT BUY !
Reviews.Author: sue
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA ONLY LASTED ONE USE, I PURCHASE THIS CAMERA IN JANUARY AND ONLY USE IT ONCE.NOW AMAZON IS MAKING IT DIFFICULT FOR ME TO RETURN THE ITEM... DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY !!!

Reviews.Title: Can't get off wide angle mode
Reviews.Author: Tommie "An expert is a former drip under pres...
Reviews.Content: My manual has been misplaced and I can't get the camera off wide angle mode OR activate the flash. When my daughter was home on a visit, she changed the settings from the original and I can't get them back. Otherwise, this camera does what I need it to do. I take pictures of recipes I'm creating to post on my blog and it does great handheld shots without the flash. Now, if I could find the manual...I tried to find one to download and struck out.

Reviews.Title: What am I missing about this camera?
Reviews.Author: salysh
Reviews.Content: I can't figure out for the life of me how this camera got so many good reviews. I have read everything that came with the camera and tried every single setting and the only mode that is usable on this camera is the "smart portrait" mode. Every other mode whether zoomed in or zoomed out, results in extremely blurry pictures. I don't have any medical issues that cause me to shake, I would say I am average if not better than average in the "shaky hand" department. I was so excited to get a camera that would take black and white pics, but that mode is useless, because as I previously stated, the only mode that will give a clear crisp picture is the smart portrait mode. I am extremely disappointed and will be returning it unless I figure out that I am in fact missing what the big deal is about this camera. I just find it hard to believe that ANYONE would rate this camera above a 1 star with the way mine is currently working.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Brianna J Smith
Reviews.Content: Flash, no flash, low ISO, high ISO doesn't matter.  This camera is unable to take a crisp clear picture indoors.  And the delay in capturing the shot is ridiculous. Booooooo!

Reviews.Title: NEVER AGAIN
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you much about this camera. The 2nd time I tried to use it, camera would not power up. We sent it back to Nikon, we have been waiting for weeks for a part to arrive. Now its time for vacation and I have no camera, and have no idea when I will get it back. THANKS FOR NOTHING NIKON. Going now to buy a Cannon.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I have ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Trish R
Reviews.Content: I was on a trip visiting family I had not seen in years and my very good and reliable camera I brought had gotten dropped by someone. I searched the internet and found this one with "Great" reviews and it was sold at a store near where I was so I ran out and bought the last one they had. It was new and from a reliable store. I and my husband read the manuel and it was easy to figure out. We both also have a lot oh camera knowledge. I am dismayed to say that EVERY Photo taken with this camera was Blurred, poorly lit even when flash was used and even in video the movie and sound quality are the worst I have ever seen. All photos both indoors and outdoors are awful in every way you can think of. More then one person took photos using this camera even a professional photographer and all are bad. Not a single one worth keeping. I bought this because I had not seen these relatives since I was a kid and wanted photographs for memories. Now I will have to rely on just my memory. I used the no name brand $20.00 camera I bought for my 12 year old daughter for some pictures and though it does not take great photos it blew away the photos taken with the Nikon l120.Unfortunately The receipt had gotten lost on our trip. I purchased it The day after easter of this year 2011. Basically now I am stuck with a camera I will never use and out the $279.99 it cost. I usually love nikon products but this is the exception. I will now think twice before buying Nikon again no matter how good the reviews are.I had to give it ! star only because it would not let me leave it at 0 stars which is what it should be.

Reviews.Title: Returned it.
Reviews.Author: Ron K.  Smythe "Ron K. Smythe"
Reviews.Content: Only fair pictures and video.  Returned and purchased the compact Canon A1200.  The Canon takes great photos and video with sound, is pocket size, has a viewfinder, works on AA batteries and in short, is the perfect camera.

Reviews.Title: nice camera takes nice pictures when i can run it
Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: this is a nice camera and takes great pictures but cannot carry my laptop around all the time so i can run the video on how to do certain things! It needs a manual with It!!!

Reviews.Title: what - no lens cap?
Reviews.Author: gilamazonfan "isaacsg"
Reviews.Content: We got this for my daughter who is a budding photographer.  She loves it, but being 13, she keeps getting marks on the huge lens.  How can Nikon offer this product that has a HUGE lens without a lens cap?

Reviews.Title: a epic fail
Reviews.Author: deuser
Reviews.Content: I should have returned this right away. I kept trying new things reading the reviews  to see what I could be doing wrong had a friend who knows about cameras look at it etc. I would not recommend this camera. It was a huge disappointment and waste of money. I should have paid more attention to the lower reviews instead of seeing all the five stars.

Reviews.Title: Uses AA batteries- very lame
Reviews.Author: Rhe
Reviews.Content: I had no idea that this camera uses AA batteries- I know from past experience with digital cameras that AA batteries do not provide long use for cameras and as such I completely avoid cameras which do not have rechargeable batteries. I was very disappointed when I opened the box to find AA batteries! I immediately packed everything up and returned. Didn't bother testing the camera

Reviews.Title: Thought I could trust Nikon and Amazon
Reviews.Author: Stan G
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera from Ritz Camera through Amazon and the camera did not work once.  I put the batteries in and got nothing.  I put different, new batteries in and got nothing.  I went to Amazon's website to try to exchange the item and got kicked off to RItz Camera.  The Ritz site did not have  instructions so I called the "contact us" number and got representative that did not speak english as a first language.  I am not sure what he said.  Needless to say, I still have nothing.  No exchange, no return authorization; just a promise to look into it and get back to me by email.  This sucks...

Reviews.Title: DSLR Companian
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: look at these specs!!!!Image Sensor: 14.1 million effective pixels. Metering: 256 segment matrix, centre-weighted average, spot. Sensor Size: 11mm CCD. Lens: Nikkor f3.5-5.8/4.5-94.5mm (25-525mm as 35 SLR equivalent). Shutter Speed: 4 to 1/4000 second. Continuous Shooting: 0.7 images/second (total 19 4320×3240 pixel shots); 15.3 images/second (total 20 2048×1536 pixel shots). Memory: SD, SDHC, SDXC cards plus 102MB internal memory. Image Sizes (pixels): 4320×3240 to 640×480. Movies: 1280×720p, 960×540, 640×480 at 30 fps. Viewfinders: 7.5cm LCD (921,000 pixels). File Formats: JPEG, MPEG4. ISO Sensitivity: Auto, 80 to 6400. Interface: USB 2.0, HDMI mini, AV, DC. Power: 4AA alkaline/lithium/NiMH, DC input. Dimensions: 109.9×76.5×78.4 WHDmm. Weight: Approx. 431 g (inc batteries and card). Price: Get a price on the Nikon COOLPIX L120 at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Horrible!
Reviews.Author: Shannon Maritch
Reviews.Content: As long as nothing moves at all the pictures look good but if the person, animal, wind move at all then it is blurry. I have 2 small children and EVERY photo of them is blurry. I am returning this today and sticking with my old camera for now. Such a disappointment!

Reviews.Title: Pradeep Panwar - Nikon Cool Pix May 2011
Reviews.Author: Panwar
Reviews.Content: Not recommended as par price.........poor quality, dont like to write more on this...Dont go for this camera..useless
